Name: Analyst-Finance
Description: Analyst-Finance  15-Nov-2018  25-Dec-2018 Responsibilities This position within Managed Healthcare Services provides financial analysis, accounting and controllership services for assigned segments of Gross to Net (G2N) within Lilly USA, LLC. This position is part of a financial team that supports the entire affiliate across each of the business units to perform planning, forecasting, reporting, business analysis and decision support for G2N activities. In addition, this role is expected to provide business analysis and leadership as an active team member on transformational projects within Contract Management and Analytics (CMA).  Key Objectives/Deliverables  Financial Controllership for assigned segments of G2N across all business units in Lilly USA, LLC Complete planning, forecast and reportingCoordinate data collection for G2N analysisCommunicate/Consult with Brands and/or financial colleagues regarding interpretation of G2N results with solid understanding of the underlying business and contracting environmentUpdate leadership on current trends and concerns and opportunitiesSupport CMA Transformational ProjectsProvide financial and business analysis on project work with an eye for process productivity and controlCollaborate with business partner to evaluate optionsReq ID45452BRAdditional Skills/PreferencesProfessional certification(CPA, CMA)Demonstrated business acumen and analytical skillsStrong communication and interpersonal skillsSound technical accounting knowledgeProficient in Microsoft Excel and comfort with modeling toolsStrong influenceLeadership and initiativeHigh learning agilityPrior financial experience with Planning/Forecasting/Reporting responsibility preferredControllership experience is a plus, but not requiredAdditional InformationLilly is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.Workplace Arrangement Local Title Analyst-Finance Job Category Finance Basic QualificationsBachelor's Degree in BusinessAt least 2-3 years of Finance/Accounting/Analytics experienceQualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the United States. Lilly does not anticipate providing sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B or TN status) for this employment position.Company Overview At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 39,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world. City Indianapolis CountryUSAState / Province Indiana Region Europe; Middle East; Africa, North America

Name: Data Analyst
Description: The IU Simon Cancer Center is seeking an experienced Data Analyst. This position will collaborate with IUSCC administrative staff, principal investigators and their teams within the Cancer Center, research and administration personnel within the IUSCC CTO, and various representatives within the CTSI/IUSM/IU Health to determine requirements for the design and development of software solutions to support various data analytics, quality, and metric reporting. This position will often work independently from other application developers, and in those cases must oversee the entire life cycle of application development and provide regular progress reports to the clients. This position must interact effectively with internal infrastructure groups to leverage the resources required to meet the technical needs of the projects.  Duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  *Perform report development, data analytics, quality assurance, data visualization, and data validation. Some database maintenance and modification will be necessary.Gather and document functional and technical data analysis requirements and translate requirements into database, reporting, and visualization solutions. Develop in-depth understanding of underlying data, data structures, and business uses to ensure solutions meet client needs and are compliant with appropriate data compliance requirements. Work with vendors to understand code changes and/or upgrades that will impact solutions and modify/test as such.Create technical documentation of solution logic, processes, and overall summary. Create test case documentation and ensure accurate and complete testing. Document status and completion of requested solutions and maintain centralized listing of solution needs and priorities.Design, develop, program, test, and maintain complex operational and analytical solutions leveraging SQL, iReport, JasperReports, database enabled websites, Tableau, and other reporting technologies. REQUIRED: Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution in informatics, information technology, healthcare information technology or other field with an information technology enhanced degree such as healthcare, finance, business, or science, plus 2 years of professional experience.  A combination of related education and experience may be considered.Preferred QualificationsExperience in a healthcare environment; knowledge of an EMR system; experience creating JasperReports or iReports. Familiar with responsive web design; user Interface development, HTML, CMS, PHP, CSS .NET; JavaScript - jQuery UI and AJAX; Adobe Photoshop; Illustrator; Flash; HTML e-mails, MySQL, LAMP, Experience with ASP.Net; Oracle and MSSQL DatabaseWorking Conditions / Physical Demands

Description: Analyst-IT26-Nov-201821-Feb-2019ResponsibilitiesMedical Development Information Technology (MD IT) serves a strategic function within Lilly Research Laboratories (LRL). The MD IT team defines and influences LRL information strategies and develops solutions to enable the realization of LRL business goals. The MD-IT Information Hub is a collection of data repositories containing clinical trial operational and results data. It also includes an information exchange platform that is used to provide rapid access to information in support of business processes across the Medicines Development Unit. The team employs an array of technologies to support many different business needs including AWS, Java, Microsoft C#, Oracle, Informatica, and OpenShift. The role of execution lead is to handle small to medium-size projects on MD IT initiatives designed to reach desired business outcomes.Key responsibilities include: Applying MD IT strategies to LRL Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionWe are seeking an experienced, highly motivated data analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate has auto insurance related experience with the ability to manage and deliver actionable data in DMC’s underwriting departments. Areas of focus include underwriting, pricing, and profiling risk and the reduction of risk to our customers. This person will have excellent technical and communication skills and will be asked to be a self-starter in building out DMC’s data capabilities within the Underwriting departments with both inward- and outward-facing applications.  Further, this candidate will exhibit strong analytical and investigative skills, a holistic understanding of the commercial insurance process, and a desire to serve our customers with a best-in-class, value-driven insurance product.  Lastly, the ideal candidate will bolster and add to DMC’s unique culture – a workplace built on enthusiasm, entrepreneurship, integrity, communication, proactive problem solving, and a genuine passion for helping our customers and agents. RESPONSIBILITIESContribute directly to DMC’s Underwriting, Underwriting Operations and Risk Engineering goals of profitable growth via the direct management of department data – you will be providing meaningful intelligence that generates and improves reporting, underwriting, risk engineering to DMC and our customers benefit.Leverage data capabilities and tools to solve business problems.Service internal and external customers in extracting, visualizing, and explaining intelligence derived from data.Archive, process and visualize data as applicableDevise and complete predictive models to improve pricing, underwriting, and servicing.Advise on appropriate service plan requirements including data requirements, scoring algorithms, and benchmarks/goals.Perform book-level analysis, in conjunction within DMC functional areas, to include Underwriting, Risk Engineering, Operations and others upon request.Assist management with special projects, management reporting and other projects as assignedOther related duties, as assigned by management.REQUIREMENTSMinimum 2 years of experience in data analyst or relevant role. Insurance industry experience is preferred.Bachelor’s Degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, information technology or related field.Ideal candidate will have proven experience leveraging data capabilities to solve business problems in an insurance setting.Proficiency with reporting tools including Excel, business intelligence and analytical tools.Strong analytical skills with ability to collect, organizing (cleaning, transforming, modeling) and disseminate actionable business observationsExcellent project management skills.Customer service orientation, strong listening skills, ability to present findings.Travel, as needed (0-10% of time) to visit key brokers/customers/prospects, support executive initiatives, and participate in industry events/trade shows if requestedMust be a self-starter with ability to manage time in a fast-paced environment, prioritize critical tasks, communicate with management on status, and deliver on objectives in a timely fashion.Must be able to work proactively in independent settings, as well as work collaboratively with a team.PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTSAbility to perform standard office tasks, including prolonged computer work.Ability to move about customer worksites or industry tradeshows and perform customary inspection or set-up tasks.Must be able to regularly lift and/or carry laptop computer with associated equipment weighing about 25 pounds. Company DescriptionDMC Insurance is an Indianapolis based Transportation Insurance Program Administrator, providing highly specialized, custom risk transfer solutions for trucking and public transportation companies throughout the United States. We are experts in transportation insurance service and leverage our expertise to deliver results for our insured customers. We are an energetic team committed to designing and developing the best insurance experience in the transportation industry. Our relationship with Crum & Forster® and Fairfax Financial Holdings result in excellent career path opportunities and benefits for our employees. All qualified applicants to DMC Insurance are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran’s status or any other protected characteristic.

Name: Compensation Analyst
Description: The Sales Compensation Analyst is a key position in the Global Sales Compensation team and is responsible for incentive commission processing, reporting and case management functions for the Commercial Business Unit team within the Comp Admin organization. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated and detail-oriented, with demonstrated problem solving and decision making skills. This role will be fully engaged in the support of our sales teams and is an outstanding opportunity to collaborate extensively with the global Sales and Services organizations and partner cross-functionally with our Crediting Operations, Design and Effectiveness, Strategy & Enablement, Human Resources, Order Management, Finance and Payroll teams. The Global Sales Compensation team based in San Francisco is the global leader for sales commission polices and processes for all of our direct and indirect sales team, including North America, EMEA, APAC and Japan.  Responsibilities: Manage the monthly commissions process for the core team of Salesforce direct sales. This includes understanding and applying the commission plan consistently, ensuring commissions calculations comply with the plan, and managing exception requests versus policy. Provide expertise, support and training to the international teams on these plans.Resolve case inquiries and be a trusted advisor to our sales team. Frequent communication with account executives and sales management via commission cases. Process corrections and adjustments as they arise.Provide recommendations to sales leadership and the internal comp management team regarding exceptions requests and case escalations.Be the trusted partner for all upstream and downstream business functions. Provide backup support within the team for the following areas: comp metrics and reporting, accounting schedules, SOX support, Commission checklists and commission administration.Document business processes and create desktop procedures for monthly/quarterly close, commission accounting tasks, and auditsExecute assigned projects as needed and recommend and deliver process improvements.Education & Experience:A minimum of 3 years of experience is required, ideally in Sales Compensation and/or accounting. A Bachelor Degree required; Finance, Economics, or related field is preferred.Strong communication (written and verbal), organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills, along with strong attention to detail.Experience in automated sales commissions systems and their set-up and operation is a plus (e.g. Xactly, Callidus, Centive, Oracle EIM, etc.)Advanced skills in MS Excel.Desired Skills:Experience with sales compensation, coverage models, quota setting and territory alignment.Experience with accounting or Financial Planning.Ability to multi-task while managing deadlines, perform well under pressure, work independently and as a part of a team.Demonstrated ability to have completed multiple, complex technical projects and to manage projects to on-time completion.Ability to succeed in a collaborative, start-up-paced environment.Good business acumen and awareness of business trends.Experience working with Sales Organizations.High degree of motivation, flexibility and creativity

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job Summary: The Financial Analyst will report to the Chief Financial Officer of Asphalt Materials Inc and be part of a team dedicated to the financial well-being of AMI's operations. It is imperative that this Financial Analyst develop and maintain a broad understanding of the company's commercial, manufacturing, supply chain, and financial operations as this knowledge will help the Financial Analyst make recommendations on course of action to the management team. Responsibilities:Provide financial, analytical, and strategic support on special projects, ad-hoc, and support long-term business needsSupport process to prepare detailed annual financial budgets and monthly financial forecastsDetermine financial status by comparing and analyzing results and variances; identifying trends and recommending actionsWork with business units and cross-functional organizations to accomplish task by leading and coordinating information requirementsPrepare high quality, professional, and accurate presentations and memorandums for management and board of directors in a timely basisDevelop detailed financial models for potential transactions, including but not limited to M&A, capital expenditures, and plant expansionsQualifications/ RequirementsOne to three years of relevant experience in financial planning and analysis or corporate developmentA bachelor's degree in finance or accounting, or equivalent practical experience Top 20 business school preferredExceptional proficiency in Excel: discounted cash flow modeling, scenario analysis, and statistical analysisDemonstrated work experience: financial statement analysis, modeling, and reporting; critical thinking, and executive presentationsStrong interpersonal skills with proven ability to collaborate effectively using broad range of influence styles to drive desired resultsImpeccable written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey various forms of information to broad audienceHigh degree of self-confidence, poise, maturity, discretion, and diplomacySelf-motivated and passionate with a drive for success enthusiastic about delivering high quality work and making a difference in your function, our company, and our industryAbility to work with and act in utmost confidentiality with sensitive company informationHave a strong ownership mentality and drive for resultsSound problem solver who can quickly process complex information and present it clearly and simplyStrong knowledge of MS Office applications including Word, Excel, SharePoint, Access, and PowerPointThe Heritage Group and Asphalt Materials Inc.: Asphalt Materials Inc. is a segment of The Heritage Group of companies. The Heritage Group (THG) is a family-owned company that has been in operation for over 80 years. THG turns big challenges into even bigger opportunities. THG is a family of relationship-builders, problem-solvers and opportunity seekers that aim to make a difference in the world. THG manages a portfolio of over thirty independent businesses that operate in distinct industry operating groups Construction and Materials, Environmental Services, and Energy & Refining. This vast experience combined with a team management style allows for the diversity of a large conglomerate and the personal service of a smaller, customer-focused organization. THG is a growth-oriented company with operations in North America, Europe, and Asia and a customer network that spans the globe. As a family-owned business, a long-term financial approach and conservative investment philosophy has placed the Company on a solid foundation to pursue growth opportunities as they appear. The organization has a creative culture, always searching for opportunities and researching industry-changing solutions. The company has grown impressively over the past 30 years both organically and by acquisition, often turning around distressed businesses.

Name: SAP General Accounting FICO Functional Analyst
Description: SAP General Accounting FICO Functional Analyst  30-Nov-2018  29-Jan-2019 ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities: Lilly is a global healthcare leader that unites caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We were founded more than a century ago by a man committed to creating high-quality medicines that meet real needs, and today we remain true to that mission in all our work. Across the globe, Lilly employees work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to communities through philanthropy and volunteerism.  The SAP FI-CO Functional Analyst will work within the GA team, which is part of the wider Global Services IT organization. Global Services IT (GSIT) is responsible for providing solutions for SAP and SAP-integrated systems, enabling supply chain management, human resources, and financial business processes. A key role within the GA team is the SAP FI-CO Functional Analyst. The primary focus will be collaborating with our business partners, and influencing the processes, tools and operating models within the General Accounting (GA) area. GA includes functional support for treasury, tax, product costing and other financial platforms. The role will involve both determining the nature of the business need (“Define and Design”) by partnering with Functional Architects and enabling solution delivery (“Build, Test, and Deploy”) orchestrating/coordinating resources including External Service Providers (ESPs). The SAP FI-CO Functional Analyst role includes understanding the SAP global template and the impact of making changes whether through the change/enhancement or project delivery methodology, ensuring that these services are provided on time, on budget, and in a quality and compliant manner in order to meet required business outcomes. Key Objectives/Deliverables:Partner and collaborate with global, regional and local Business Partners as appropriate in order to better understand the business and its priorities, and represent their requirements within the SAP landscape.Lead, manage and participate in day to day operations, enhancements and projects. This includes understanding business impact, quantifying resources, and evaluating/recommending technical options.Partner with the business in assessing and defining requirements and lead/execute the development of business cases and system solutions.Influence partner organizations to manage and prioritize incidents, system changes and projects.Promote process improvements and innovation to drive business process optimization.Partner with third party providers to accomplish delivery of day to day operations, enhancements and projects. This includes: service level management, resource evaluations, escalations of system issues and oversight of the change management processes.Be forward thinking with respect to using various SAP technologies which will help improve the user experience.Be an advocate for SAP at global, regional and local level to communicate standards and expectations.Opportunity to become an expert in the SAP technologies that run the Lilly financial business processes, as well as the opportunity to understand the business processes that drive the business.Identify and ensure delivery of training needs between IT and the business.Where appropriate, work with colleagues on the GA team in SAP areas of treasury, tax, product costing, legal compliance, and SAP bolt-on systems.Leverage, and further develop, SAP FI technical skills in areas of FI, CO, Banking, Profitability, Tax, Assets and Product Costing to power the Lilly business to better serve patients and stakeholders around the world.Req position.Occasional off hours and weekend work is expected as this position serves a global organization.Some regional and international travel will be required to meet with business partners and develop key working relationships as part of a global function.Lilly is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, colour, religion, gender, sexual Name: Credit Analyst
Description: Now is an exciting time to join our team here at Coastal Credit, LLC!  Coastal Credit is a National Sub-Prime Auto Lender with 30 years of success in the Automotive Marketplace. We are currently looking for a Credit Analyst to join our team at our headquarters in Indianapolis. Position Summary: The Credit Analyst reviews consumer auto loan applications submitted by local and national car dealerships. This position is responsible for following internal lending guidelines in decisioning the applications in a timely manner. It is a customer service focused position and primarily interacts with dealerships in reviewing and structuring the auto loan applications to maximize business. There will be heavy interaction with the Account Executive (sales) and Funding teams as well. Responsibilities: - Review and decision indirect credit applications submitted by automobile dealerships, both Franchise and Independent Make decisions on credit applications quickly and accurately based on internal lending guidelinesDiscuss and negotiate loan decisions with automobile dealership personnelPerform outbound phone calls while decisioning and following up on applicationsConsistently meet and exceed applicable daily/weekly/monthly goals for application decision volume, inbound and outbound phone volume, and booked loan goalsDeveloping and maintaining effective relationships with dealershipsAlign with Account Executives to grow specific marketsWork with Funding Department to ensure credit applications are verified and meet company underwriting guidelinesAbility to answer funding questions and educate dealers to minimize returned contracts and achieve funding time goals Qualifications:Bachelors Degree preferred, or equivalent work experiencePrior experience in auto industry or consumer finance preferredAbility to communicate effectively to develop and maintain strong business relationshipsAbility to work in a fast-paced environment, multi task and priority setStrong customer service skillsStrong knowledge of financial collateral requirements and credit profilesAbility to work varied shifts, evenings, Saturdays and some Holidays

Name: Collections Analyst
Description: Collection Analysts are directly responsible for working with our end user customers to receive payments for products and services. The position’s contribution is that by ensuring that the accounts receivable portfolio turns into cash, the company’s cash flow performance continues to grow each quarter. The investment community values our company at a high valuation multiple as a direct result of our excellent free cash flow performance. Consistent cash flow performance funds not only operating expenses but also investments in research and development to enable us to continue to grow.  As the Accounts Receivable portfolio for the company continues to grow in dollar amount as well as the number of invoices, we continue to need additional resources to manage it. This position will be assigned an individual Accounts Receivable portfolio of between $15 and $25 million in which they will be accountable for its performance. Responsibilities: · Works with customers in assigned customer portfolio to receive payments. Resolves customer A/R differences to the satisfaction of both client and our customers. Uses good business judgment in working with/through other employees including Sales to achieve results.  · Initiates contacts on assigned account base. Exercises good business judgment and due diligence in evaluating ability/intent to pay within the overall account relationship.  · Facilitate customer payments by providing necessary documentation to customer  · Resolves customer account differences working with other employees including Sales.  · Uses good judgment in balancing the ability to resolve issues with the need to escalate them to the appropriate person  · Participates on process improvement projects as assigned  · Provides reports on assigned portfolio as requested to A/R Operations management  · Ensures compliance with all company policies  · Provides training as requested. Experience/Skills Required: · 2+ Years of Collections Experience  · Bachelors degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.  · Good customer relationship skills to manage a variety of customer interactions  · Demonstrated initiative  · Ability to work independently  · Ability to excel in a fast growing/fast paced environment delivering accuracy while managing to  deadlines  · Thrives in a team environment  · Past participation in process improvement initiatives and/or business improvement projects

Name: Business Analyst (Level I)(Fraud Investigations) in New York at BCforward
Description: Job DescriptionBusiness Analyst (Level I)(Fraud Investigations) BCforward is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Business Analyst (Level I)(Fraud Investigations) in New York, NY- 10038Description:Job Title: Business Analyst (Level I)Location: New York, NY- 10038 Expected Duration:04 Months Contract with possible extension Fraud investigators will be responsible for reviewing incoming referrals for possible regulatory reporting and/or a full file investigation. Identifies red flags related to the various fraud types; primarily wealth management brokerage products.  - Project is more brokerage related, but team will consider candidates who retail banking fraud experience. Training on systems and assignment will be provided, but must have fraud background in order to create reports.  Daily activities include:  - Identifying, investigating and documenting unusual activity relative to current and/or prospective customers.  - Skill in prioritizing assignments to complete work in a timely manner when there are: changes in workload, changes in case assignment, challenges with meeting deadlines, competing requirements, and familiar with working in high volume production environment.  TOP 3 Required skills:  1)Knowledge of multiple bank products, particularly brokerage products.  2)Financial Crimes Experience in investigations with SAR reporting experience, including SEC SAR filings.  3)Strong written and verbal communication About BCforward: BCforward began as an IT business solutions and staffing firm. Founded in 1998, BCforward has grown with our customers' needs into a full service personnel solutions organization. Headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana, BCforward also operates numerous delivery centers across North America and India. We are currently the largest consulting firm and largest MBE certified firm in Indiana. Our uninterrupted growth has allowed BCforward to deliver uniquely configured IT staffing and project solutions for over years of catering to our customers' specific needs. BCforward currently maintains a team of over 5000 global resources. With our additional brand, Stafforward, together we have the capabilities to deliver services for a variety of industries in both public and private sectors which allows us to address your most challenging needs.  www.BCforward.com  This posting is not an offer of employment. All applicants must be authorized to work in the United States and willing cooperate with a background check and drug screen, to the extent permitted by federal and local laws up to, and including, both criminal and financial reviews. The submission of intentionally false or fraudulent information in response to this job posting shall render the applicant ineligible for the position. BCforward is an equal opportunity employer. Any subsequent offer of employment shall be considered employment at will regardless of the anticipated assignment duration.  Interested candidates please send resume in Word format Please reference job code 75101 when responding to this ad.

Name: Collection Analyst
Description: Description: Directly responsible for ensuring that the accounts receivable portfolio turns into cash thereby positively impacting cash flow through their direct customer collection efforts. Healthy cash flow is looked upon by the investment community as both an efficiency and finance measure which translates into a component of our stock price. Healthy cash flow funds operating expenses as well as investments in research and development to enable us to grow. 2-4 years’ experience. Responsibilities:Initiates collection calls on assigned account base in accordance with Invoice Life Cycle Guidelines by exercising good business judgment and due diligence in evaluating account solvency and ability/willingness to pay;Facilitate customer payment by providing necessary documentation to customer;Resolves customer billing disputes working with other Sales Operations personnel and Sales. Escalates problem collection accounts to Credit and Sales management;Works with credit analyst on financial distress accounts;Negotiates payment plans for financial distress accounts;Recommends accounts for suspension after proper collection activity;Participates on process improvement projects as assigned;Provides reports on assigned portfolio as requested to credit management;Ensures compliance with all company policies;Provides training as requested.SkillsCollections experience in a high growth environment;Good customer relationship skills to manage a variety of customer iterations;Demonstrated initiative;Ability to work independently;Demonstrated participation in process improvement initiatives and/or project management experience;Excellent communication (written and verbal) skills;Ability to excel in a fast growing/fast paced environment delivering accuracy while managing to deadlines;Thrives in a team environment;Able to use Microsoft suite of tools effectively.

Name: Senior Credit Analyst
Description: JOB OVERVIEWUnderwrites loan requests for business and commercial real estate, reviewing and analyzing financial and industry data, borrower performance and management capabilities to assess credit worthiness and estimate the degree of risk involved in extending credit to commercial customers.PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIESAccountable for meeting specified goals related to proper loan risk rating determinations, quality of loan presentation and productivity. Represent the Bank to both internal and external customers in a courteous, professional manner in face-to-face, written and telephone communications. Responsible for adherence to regulatory compliance standards including Bank Secrecy Act (BSA), company policies and procedures, as well as the quality and timeliness of departmental activities. Actively protect confidentiality of customer and account information. Demonstrate Horizon Bank's commitment to the communities in which we serve through active involvement in local organizations and events. DUTIES• Perform the initial and ongoing credit analyses to determine if customer loan requests satisfy policy and procedure guidelines, and prepare and process all applicable documentation. Make recommendations to Loan Officers when requests fall outside of policy. • Prepare objective written credit analyses for Loan Officers and Loan Committee including recommendation of risk ratings for complex new loans or the renewal of existing facilities, detailing debt service coverage, collateral coverage, payment history, personal financial statements and cash flow, loan relationship, liquidity, leverage and guarantor strength.• Recommend procedural changes to management when inconsistencies are discovered during the underwriting process. • Consult with loan officers on proper loan structure and covenants.• Demonstrates expertise in proper loan structuring, legal and documentation issues, industry considerations that affect borrower types, credit policy and underwriting requirements.• Perform all work in compliance with established regulations, policies, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and instructions. • Participate in ongoing skill, compliance, product, market, risk management and security training as required for the position and apply knowledge in performance of daily tasks. • Other duties as assignedQUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS• Bachelor's degree in business, finance or accounting or equivalent combination of education and relevant work experience. • Minimum of 3-5 years' experience as a credit analyst in commercial banking or commercial real estate environment preferred • Experience with government lending programs (SBA 7a, SBA 504, USDA) preferred.• Knowledge of use of Microsoft Office Software required and Credit Quest (or similar underwriting software) a plus.• Thorough knowledge of commercial lending practices and industry standards • Ability to comprehend and utilize Appraisal Reports, Environmental Reports, Title Work and other Legal Documentation.• Exceptional organization, time management and follow-up skills. Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with customers, bank employees and outside service providers.• Ability to follow detailed instructions and a wide range of procedures requiring superb analytical skills, detailed documentation and sound judgement. • Ability to perform complex mathematical computations using various business machines and/or computers. Must have proficient typing and computer skills.COMPETENCIES• Analytical Thinking • Risk Assessment• Attention to Detail • Time Management• Regulatory Compliance • Written CommunicationPHYSICAL REQUIREMENTSReasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)Physical Demand: Percentage of Time:• Communicate with advisors, customers, vendors and managers regarding banking transactions and issues. Able to exchange accurate information with others. 90-100%• Able to verify authenticity of financial instruments, forms, documents and signatures. Able to verify identity of customers, vendors and service providers. Able to observe actions of others to ensure safety and security of the facility. 90-100%• Able to grasp, move and sort forms and papers. 90-100%• Constantly operate a computer and other office machinery such as calculator, copy machine, fax machine, scanner, printer and telephone 90-100%• Able to remain stationary at a desk for long periods of time 75-100%• Regularly move about the office to access file cabinets, storage drawers and various office equipment 75-100%• Regularly travel to other locations such as customer office or building site, restaurant or other Horizon locations to meet with customer. Some overnight travel may be required. 50-75%• Occasionally position self to reach heights between floor and 6' This Job Description reflects management's assignment of duties and responsibilities and is subject to change at any time.EEO Employer/Vet/Disabled Keywords:underwriter, credit, analyst, credit analyst, financial advisor, loans, lending, bank, Horizon Bank

Name: Sr. Demand Planning Analyst
Description: Carrier is the worlds leader in high-technology heating, air-conditioning and refrigeration solutions. Carrier is a part of UTC Climate, Controls & Security, a unit of United Technologies Corp., a leading provider to the aerospace and building systems industries worldwide. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and are looking for an opportunity to develop your supply chain career, then we have a great opportunity for you. We are seeking a motivated, process-oriented individual to contribute to our supply chain effectiveness from the supplier through the end customer. GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES: We currently have an opportunity for a Sr Demand Planning Analyst to join the Supply Chain Planning organization for North America HVAC Systems and Services. This position will provide a key link between the production and procurement activities in the OEM business and the demand in the distribution channel across the business. In addition, the position will play a leading role in coordinating and improving the existing Sales & Operations Planning process. The successful candidate will coordinate processes and systems in the following key areas: Improving overall service level for customers in the distribution channel.Improving inventory turns while managing to inventory targets.Improving inventory availability and matching mix more closely to true customer demand.Improving overall productivity of assets (inventory, logistics, facilities.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:Lead the development, implementation and refinement of a distributor demand management process/system to allow daily reviews of distributor inventory positions and early proactive identification of pending availability issues.Analyze daily distributor demand intelligence against forecasts and recommend proactive inventory or scheduling actions to address.Produce regular trending analysis on availability issues, accounting for geography, seasonality, product transitions and sales programs.Establish standards or standard work for demand forecasting.Refine and improve current S&OP information collection process to make it more efficient and productive. Provide support to gain consensus on final monthly forecasts presented to executive management.Analyze and recommend options to reduce Excess and Obsolete through phase-in/phase-out process and sku rationalizationCandidate will be a key participant in S&OP process overall and a specific contributor to Commercial Accessory planning and Demand Planning efforts. Additional opportunities to lead project teams within Supply Chain and Logistics organization will become available as initiatives are developed.Actively lead process improvement projects on cross functional teams.Individual will have oversight of Commercial Accessory planning, inventory levels, and drive improvement on inventory turns.Candidate will be heavily involved in the Demand Planning process and improvements to the existing SAP APO tools.Represent Demand Planning / Supply Chain and Logistics in key business initiatives to reduce inventory, improve lead times, and increase customer on time performance.Qualification:The ideal candidate will be a high energy, dynamic individual looking for an opportunity to join a diverse organization in a very competitive environment. Successful candidates will have: Excellent proven analytical skillsAbility to analyze disparate information and draw conclusions/recommendationsKnowledge and experience with demand forecasting (statistical and business process)Strong verbal, written and inter-personal communication skillsAbility to work across organizational boundaries and Supply Chain organizationProficiency in MS Office tools, especially Excel and AccessExperience with SAP and Business IntelligenceWorking knowledge of SAP APO planning systemExperience in leading cross functional projectsEducation:BA/BS degree with 4-7+ years of experienceMA/MS degree with 2-5+years of experience United Technologies Corporation is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

An environment with flexibility, competitive compensation, benefits and growth! You may never want to leave! ****SAPRecord to Report (RTR) Analystfor a Full Time Direct Hire role.Full Time Direct HireSalary $100k- $118k5% BonusIdeally the client wants the candidate to work onsite inIndianapolis, IN OR Richmond, INOpen to Remote. Candidate Must be able to work Eastern Time Zone. Candidate needs to be based in Eastern Time Zone.*** Remote work option will be considered for the right candidate but must be able to come onsite when needed. Required Travel: 10% There will be around 10 - 15% travel USA or internationally, it comes in waves respective to the projects the client is working on.SAP Record to Report (RTR) AnalystSAP techno functionalCandidate should have significant SAP customization experienceHiTech or Process industry background is a big plusSAP Record to Report (RTR) Analyst This position which sits inside the Global HR and ERP Finance IT Pillar is responsible for managing the health of our Global ERP Financial application portfolio consisting of a number of Key Systems an on premise SAP ERP Global System, Legacy ERP Systems, Oracle Hyperion Financial Management, SumTotal Expense Management, and various integration interfaces between these systems.  This hands-on role will ensure that all projects and system support primarily in the Record to Report (RTR) business areas are implemented and maintained to quality by adopting best practice configuration and technology. The Functional role will be involved with Application Analysis and Design, System Configuration, Integration, Testing, Maintenance and Support for the delivery of projects and minor/major releases primarily for RTR. This includes supporting the companys month end close processes.  They will work closely with SAP Technical Analysts and business owners to understand the business requirements and deliver solutions that support the ongoing Global RTR IT and Business Strategy. They will also work alongside our other Functional and Technical Consultants we contract with from time to time for our larger initiatives across the ERP domain. Responsibilities:Responsible for the functional well-being of the clients on premise Global ERP SAP system (primarily FI-CO modules) and the related integrations with our other Financial systems with primary responsibility for the RTR functional areasAct as functional and configuration design authority for the RTR Application portfolioPartner with our SAP BASIS and Security team to ensure that our environments are maintained and our systems are patched regularlyLead the functional design and implementation of our RTR projects, enhancements, cyclical processes and system supportTo develop quality functional configuration and requirements documentation adhering to team and departmental standardsTo provide SAP functional support including analysis, configuration, testing, tracking and resolutionTo demonstrate high level of communication skills (verbal and written)To ensure current skills are up-to-date through research and practiceTo engage professionally with our RTR business stakeholdersQualification:Bachelors degree in a technical related fieldMinimum 7 years hands on SAP ERP Techno Functional and System Configuration experienceMinimum of 5 years functional and process knowledge managing RTR business processesMinimum 2 years hands on SAP FICOMinimum 3 years hands on experience with designing and developing integrations with complex systems knowledge of Dell Boomi is a plusKnowledge on ERP trends and industry best practicesPossess a strong track record of business process engineering leadership with a "hands on" style. Important skills include facilitating resolution of design conflicts, partnering effectively with leadership at different levels to gain consensus, creating workable and realistic plans, and ensuring a smooth executionBe customer focused, seeking constantly to understand from the customer's point of view, the problems being faced and the solutions that may work bestStrong System Integration and Data Migration experience is a plusExperience implementing, designing and enforcing project management methodology and controlsExcellent communication and interpersonal skills For immediate consideration please submit your resume in Word format, along with daytime contact information. Client is unable to provide H-1B Visa sponsorship at this time. All submittals will be treated confidentially. Selected candidate may be asked to pass a comprehensive background, credit and/or drug screening. Principals only, no third parties please.  Established in 2000, Atrilogy Solutions Group, Inc. provides organizations of all sizes with high-quality, cost effective information technology (IT) and business process consulting & staffing services. Our industry-leading service model combines experienced project managers with seasoned technical and functional consultants to eliminate client uncertainty and deliver superior value and results.  Clients turn to Atrilogy for expertise in: IT staffing and placement (Project Managers, Agile/Scrum Masters, Business Analysts, DBAs, Software Engineers, Mobile Developers (iOS, Android), DevOps, Automation, QA, Systems & Network Engineers, Cyber Security / Information Security Specialists)All major ERP & CRM packages (including Oracle, Workday, PeopleSoft, JD Edwards, Lawson, SAP, Dynamics AX, Salesforce, Microsoft CRM, NetSuite)Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, and Big Data IntegrationCreative (Interactive Project Manager/Art Director, Information Architect, UI/UX Designer, Web/Graphic Design) Atrilogy has been recognized by Inc. magazine as one of the nations fastest-growing, privately-held companies. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: More than a career - a chance to make a difference in people's lives.  Build an exciting, rewarding career with us help us make a  difference for millions of people every day. Consider joining the Duke  Energy team, where you'll find a friendly work environment,  opportunities for growth and development, recognition for your work,  and competitive pay and benefits.  This role can be located at any Duke Energy office. ===================================================Position Summary This position is responsible for designing, developing, and  maintaining dynamic reports, dashboards, and data visualization  solutions using business intelligence reporting tools. Includes  developing complex SQL queries, scripts, and stored procedures to  deliver data sets required for advance Business Intelligence  reporting. ResponsibilitiesCreates comprehensive reporting packages that provides visually appealing data insights and details across multiple channels that  align with core business objectives. Works directly with stakeholders to gather and translate reporting requirements into deliverables. Illustrates data in meaningful, professional and easy to understand formats for various audiences. Learns the business and key performance indicators to provide better analytic solutions across multiple channels. Produces wireframes and mockups to demonstrate proposed solutions in a fast-pace environment. Designs, develops, tests, documents and maintains database queries and reports. Gathers data inputs from moderately complex data sources, both internally and externally. Develops systematic reporting processes and procedures to ensure timely delivery of daily, weekly, monthly, annual and ad hoc  reporting to management. Maintains and enhances existing reports and dashboards.Troubleshoots reporting and data integrity concerns to ensure completeness to meet business needs. Combines various data sources into a comprehensive understanding of customer behaviors and feedback for channel and service  improvement opportunities. Communicates requirements to Data Architects and ETL teams for extracting data from various data sources, creating new data  warehouses and data marts.  Basic/Required Qualifications Bachelor s degree from a four-year college or university or 7 years of related experience in lieu of a degree 3 years of related experience in information technology, sales & marketing, e-commerce, customer services, project management, or  process improvement Desired QualificationsBS/BA degree in Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration or equivalent. 3 to 5+ years of related experience in a Data Scientist, Reporting Developer or Analyst role. Must be prepared to demonstrate a professional portfolio, either online or printed. Accomplished at designing and creating data visualization reporting solutions and dynamic dashboards using business  intelligence and reporting tools such as Microsoft Power BI,  Report Builder, SSRS, PowerPivot, SAS, Tableau and / or equivalent  reporting tools. Demonstrated ability to package information in a clear, concise and in a visually appealing manner. Proficient in developing complex SQL queries, scripts, and stored procedures from Relational Databases in a SQL/Oracle Server  environment. Experience communicating requirements to Data Architects and ETL teams for extracting data from various data sources, creating new  data warehouses and data marts. Must be capable of transitioning departmental reporting environment to Power BI. Desire and passion to learn new data visualization techniques, new competencies and skills independently to recommend and implement  new reporting methods and procedures. Must be creative, responsive and adaptive in a dynamic environment. Excellent analytical and problem solving capabilities with special attention to accuracy and detail. Self-starter with a proven ability to take ownership of job responsibilities and ensure successful completion of all projects  and requests. Ability to effectively prioritize and multi-task in high volume workload situations. Experience in various programming languages SQL, DAX, R, Visual Basic and / or equivalent programming language a required. Familiarity with processes of SSIS, ETL and OLAP a plus but not required.  Travel Requirements 15-25% Relocation Assistance Provided (as applicable)  No  Represented/Union Position  No  Visa Sponsored Position  No  Posting Expiration Date  Friday, November 30, 2018  All job postings expire at 12:01 AM on the posting expiration date.  Please note that in order to be considered for this position, you must  possess all of the basic/required qualifications.

Name: Undergrad SAP Business Process Analyst - Full Time
Description: Job Category: Information Technology Type of Employment: Full-Time Employment - FTE Responsibilities:AP Business Process Analyst Overview: Lilly seeks analysts who will contribute to the Global Finance and Supply Chain business organization while allowing you to build a comprehensive understanding of financial and supply chain business processes in the pharmaceutical industry, and enable you to create business process solutions for Eli Lilly and Company. Your responsibilities will include:  + Understanding finance and supply chain business processes and then proposing solutions which advance our business strategy to improve the efficiency, effectiveness, and control mindedness of our processes through the utilization of technology to improve productivity and reduce costs  + Designing and developing business process solutions in teams with our information technology partners and operational business experts, who are performing business processes such as month-end financial closing, processing customer orders, supply chain planning, and distribution operations  + Providing business process and SAP training, consulting, high-level problem resolution, and process improvement suggestions  + Ensuring our solutions are reliable and capable through testing  + Searching for and implementing continuous improvements to drive greater value or reduce cost  + Managing business customer relationships in order to ensure our needs are consistently met Basic Qualificiations: + Currently attending school and will be graduating with a Bachelor?s degree and/or Master?s degree by August 2019 in an Information Technology, Business or Scientific related program  + Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the United States. Eli Lilly and Company does not anticipate providing sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B status) for this employment position. Additional Skills/Preferences: + A strong commitment to a business career leveraging technology to improve business processes in finance and supply chain areas  + Strong analysis/problem assessment skills  + Well-developed written and verbal communication skills  + Demonstrated teamwork/interpersonal skills  + Leadership experience inside and/or outside the classroom  + Previous internship or co-op experience within the pharmaceutical industry Additional Information:Additional Benefits: + Working with multiple business functions around the world to implement new business processes. These functions include sales & marketing, research & development, manufacturing and general & administrative stakeholders. These innovative roles ensure we are always putting our best foot forward to deliver outstanding solutions for the business. Putting our patients first is what we do.  + Actively participating on large-cross functional teams to deliver complex SAP projects on time and within budget  + Adapting to business changes at unprecedented speed and scale. Every day we are solving new challenges so that we can make life better for our patients.  Lilly is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status. Company Overview:Who We Are: Lilly is a global healthcare leader that unites caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world.  We?re a Fortune 500 company, determined to bring life-changing medicines to those who need them and give back to communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. To learn more about Lilly, please visit us at http://bit.ly/lillycareer Lilly offers: + A Purposeful Career?bringing together people who discover and deliver life-changing medicines that improve peoples? lives around the world.  + A Balance of Work and Life?creating an environment for employees to be productive in both their lives and their work.  + An Opportunity for Growth?providing opportunities for each individual to develop and advance professionally.  + A Diverse Culture?committed to uniting individuals across cultures, and developing a comfortable, connected, environment that values diverse thought.  + A Vibrant Community?headquartered in downtown Indianapolis, Ind. ? Time Magazine ranked Indianapolis a top 10 city to start a new career in. Read more about living in Indianapolis at downtownindy.org. We?re looking for: + Highly motivated and driven leaders  + Individuals with integrity, excellence and respect for people.  + Individuals who want to make a difference in someone else?s life. Name: Data Analyst
Description: As a member of the Employee Success Operations team, this role is responsible for and has a focus on HR systems production support, data quality, reporting, audits and process improvement initiatives to support the broader global Employee Success objectives and ultimately, our growth. Role Responsibilities: Complete complex data loads  Participate in testing and implementing system upgrades and rollout of new features.  Act as technical point of contact and subject matter expert that ensures data integrity, global standardization of key processes and transactions, analyzing data flows and Workday business processes.  Liaise with Employee Success centers of expertise to improve and implement new programs and processes.  Gather requirements from stakeholders and subject matter experts. Document business process definitions and requirements to engage and prioritize work on the HRIS Roadmap.  Manage and resolve Tier 2 case escalations within SLA, providing high quality and accurate solutions  Conduct data audits and related problem resolution  Support standard and ad-hoc reports, templates, dashboards, scorecards, and metrics  Identify and participate in continuous improvement initiatives  Participation in related projects such as Mergers and Acquisitions, System related projects, and other project roll outs  Partner with Employee Success teams to provide operationally efficient solutions utilizing technology.  Research and resolve issues across HR applications. Qualifications and Experience: Bachelor’s degree required.  2-3 years previous experience in human resources shared services environment or equivalent  Systematic thinker with high degree of proficiency in Workday  Minimum of 2 years of significant working experience with an HR system, preferably Workday.  Ability to think critically, analyze, and interpret employee/employment data and root cause analysis  Ability to manage multiple responsibilities in a fast-moving, high-volume environment while effectively managing time, prioritizing assignments and working within deadlines.  Must be well organized with keen attention to detail with demonstrated effective follow-up skills.  Maintain acceptable level of teamwork by incorporating a positive attitude, a sense of humor, being supportive in words and actions, embodying our culture, and communicating at all levels both within the existing team & anyone outside the direct reporting structure.  High degree of motivation and initiative to seek out additional responsibilities volunteering for special projects, identifying oneself as a go-to individual, flexibility with change and a passion for the team, the employee experience and the company.  Regular and predictable attendance is required  Microsoft Excel experience required.  Knowledge of ADP Payforce, and system integrations an asset.

Name: Communications Analyst
Description: Communications AnalystRole Description:The Communications Analyst is dynamic, creative, and inquisitive and has great interpersonal skills to develop and execute robust internal communications. As part of the Adoption, Communications, & Training team in Business Technology, you will develop and deploy communications for the end user: working closely with subject matter experts to quickly learn technical information and create effective materials to enable stakeholders. This individual will help us deliver compelling messages to effectively prepare employees for internal systems changes, engage employees, and celebrate project success.Your Impact:Collaborate with cross-functional teams to determine appropriate communication requirements and develop communications plans. Process technical information, complex business processes, and feedback to create relevant and user-friendly communications for employees that are consistent with our voice and aligned with brand guidelines. Write communications for a variety of channels, including email, Salesforce Chatter, internal digital screens, newsletters, and more. Proofread all messages to ensure accurate, relevant information, and partner with teammates to deliver communications in a timely way. Use digital tools and full suite of features to build, execute, and publish communications, manage audience lists, and track metrics. Respond to and effectively manage communication requests and operational alerts to address both planned and unplanned technical messages.Drive and contribute to operational improvements for managing and tracking incoming requests and efficient delivery of communications: Use data to analyze and improve communications.Basic Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Communication, Journalism, Marketing, Business, Information SystemsMust be within 1 year of graduation or have a Spring 2019 graduation date Excellent listening, verbal and written communication skills (both technical and creative)Familiar with and aptitude to learn new technology and have the ability to work in a fast paced highly technical environment Experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud or other email marketing tool Ability to understand complex technical issues and translate to simple user-friendly communications Experience developing graphically interesting and compelling presentations and collateralAbility to write content for a variety of channels and adjust voice and tone based on scenario and needsProofreading ability to check text for grammar, spelling, accuracy, and corporate guidelinesAbility to build strong partnerships and collaborate with teammates and technical/business partnersExperience with social media and its impact to internal projectsSelf-starter with a proven track record in performing well in a fast paced environment; can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilitiesInquisitive, curious, and open to feedback and developmentAbility to effectively manage multiple concurrent projects and learn new applications quicklyPreferred ExperienceExperience with Salesforce Chatter or other enterprise collaboration platformBasic HTML knowledgeGraphic design experienceTo apply: Please submit resume and 2-3 writing samples to showcase your work. About Futureforce:Futureforce is for college students or new grads wanting to experience life at Salesforce, one of the World’s Most Innovative Companies 5­-years-­running and one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” 8-years-running. Futureforce interns work on live projects, giving them the opportunity to make a tangible impact that they can show to friends, family, and future employers ­­if we don’t hire them first (and, we hire 80% of our eligible interns)! They have the chance to collaborate and connect with the Salesforce interns from all over the world. And, like all Salesforce employees, interns also have many possibilities to volunteer, making a lasting impact in the community.Futureforce offers a collaborative work environment, which fosters innovation, provides flexibility and most importantly is fun!About Salesforce:Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” five years in a row and one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for \"family\") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world. Posting StatementSalesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.
