Name: Bus Info Analyst II/ Bus Info Analyst Sr- Indianapolis PS
Description: Your Talent. Our Vision. At Anthem, Inc., it’s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we’re creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will drive the future of health care.This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve atone of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.The Business Info Analyst II is responsible for analyzing, reporting and developing recommendations on data related to multiple, varied business metrics. Primary duties may include, but are not limited to: Creates and maintains databases to track business performance. Analyzes data and summarizes performance using summary statistical procedures. Develops and analyzes business performance reports (e.g. for claims data, provider data, utilization data) and provides notations of performance deviations and anomalies.Creates and publishes periodic reports, makes necessary recommendations, and develops ad hoc reports as needed. May require taking business issue and devising best way to develop appropriate diagnostic and/or tracking data that will translate business requirements into usable decision support tools. The Business Info Analyst Sr is responsible for analyzing, reporting and developing recommendations on data related to complex and varied business metrics. Typically provides technical assistance to lower level staff. Primary duties may include, but are not limited to:Creates and maintains databases to track business performance. Analyzes data and summarizes performance using summary statistical procedures. Understand performance measurement, e.g. rejection threshold edits for market(s) and impact to market contractual metricsPerform data analysis and data sampling to identify issues and spot trends as related to pends, rejects, and remitsAccurately translate state encounters requirement and document these into business requirements and test plansDevelops and analyzes business performance reports (e.g. for claims data, provider data, utilization data) and provides notations of performance deviations and anomalies. Creates and publishes periodic reports, as well as any necessary ad hoc reports. May require taking business issue and devising best way to develop appropriate diagnostic and/or tracking data that will translate business requirements into usable decision support tools. May make recommendations based upon data analysis. Requirements Info Analyst II: a BS/BA degree in related field; 2-4 years related operational and/or data analysis experience; experience in database structures, and standard query and reporting tools; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background. Experience with transaction data sets, knowledge of 837 and claims data, solid SQL experience, This job is more focused on technical expertise and analysis as compared to the Bus Info Analyst I job.Requirements Info Analyst Sr: Requires a BS/BA degree in related field; 3-5 years data analysis or related experience; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background. Experience with relational databases and knowledge of query tools and statistical software is required. Experience with transaction data sets, knowledge of 837 and claims data, solid SQL experience, Ability to manipulate large sets of data is also required. Strong analytical, organizational and problem solving skills. This job is focused on complex and varied metrics, making recommendations and providing assistance to staff as compared to the Bus Info Analyst II job.This position must sit in the Indianapolis office.Anthem, Inc. is ranked as one of America’s Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine and is a 2018 DiversityInc magazine Top 50 Company for Diversity. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.antheminc.com. An Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran.

Name: Operations Analyst
Description: At Republic Airline, our mission is to provide a safe, clean and reliable flying experience. We believe this is best accomplished by focusing on our vision, “With the BEST people, products, and performance, we will be America’s Regional Airline of choice.” Republic Airline is a regional airline headquartered in Indianapolis, operating fixed-fee flights for American Airlines, Delta Air Lines, and United Airlines. The Company’s fleet consists of nearly 190 Embraer 170/175s, offering approximately 950 flights daily to 100 cities in the U.S., Canada, the Caribbean and Central America. Our crew bases include Chicago, IL (ORD), Columbus, OH (CMH), Indianapolis, IN (IND), Kansas City, MO (MCI), Miami, FL (MIA), Newark, NJ (EWR), New York, NY (LGA), Philadelphia, PA (PHL), Pittsburgh, PA (PIT) and Washington, D.C. (DCA). We have 10 maintenance bases: Charlotte, NC (CLT), Chicago, IL (ORD), Columbus, OH (CMH), Indianapolis, IN (IND), Louisville, KY (SDF), Newark, NJ (EWR), New York, NY (LGA), Philadelphia, PA (PHL), Pittsburgh, PA (PIT) and Washington, D.C. (DCA). With more than 5,500 talented aviation professionals, Republic Airline is a great place to get your career off the runway! For more information, please visit our website at www.rjet.com. POSITION PURPOSE Conducts analysis on operational processes, procedures and policies for operational efficiency and performance. Develops operational reports to be used by the Flight Operations group. Assists the Flight Operations group with preparing information that will be used by Finance in the budgeting and forecasting process with specific focus on select expenses and cost centers. Researches expenses based on operational results to identify unusual variances and discrepancies. ESSENTIAL DUTIESTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Identifies process improvements and cost savings and acts as resource for leaders on the planning and execution of strategic initiatives; ensures that key business unit decisions are in line with corporate goals.Consolidates data from various sources and creates clear, concise, consolidated, meaningful reports.Identifies opportunities that improve processes, data accuracy and efficiency within Flight Operations.Develops new reporting and analytical tools to improve process efficiency and accuracy.Understands and interpret financial information and ability to be a liaison across departments with finance and human resources. Analyzes monthly results of certain expenses including labor costs, overtime, etc.Attends budgeting and forecasting meetings with respective cost center owners and VPs.Performs other duties, analyses, reports, and presentations as assigned.REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIESThe requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability necessary to perform this job. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE. Bachelor's degree (B.A. / B.S.) in Operational Analysis, Operations Management, Industrial Management, Engineering, Accounting, Finance or related field or the equivalent combination of education and experience.At least 3 years of related experience.Advanced Microsoft Office skills.Strong analytical skills. PREFERRED EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE Performance analytics, flight operations experience, or former airline experience operational modeling and additional years of operational analysis experience.Experience with Sabre, SQL, Tableau, PowerBI, and/or Workday.Understanding of airline union contracts. LANGUAGE SKILLS  Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community. Ability to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directors.  REASONING/PROBLEM SOLVING ABILITY  Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. Able to read and interpret technical, regulatory and contractual documentation. Able to maintain confidentiality.  DECISION MAKING  Makes day to day decisions used to support strategic direction. Decisions often require some thought without established precedents or procedures. Decisions tend to be short term and usually of moderate cost. Able to work independently or as part of a team to drive results. PHYSICAL DEMANDSThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Able to move about the work environment.  Frequently required to stand, walk, sit, talk and hear. WORK ENVIRONMENTThe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an associate encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Typically not exposed to extreme environmental conditions. TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS Travel up to 10% of the time, including overnight travel.

Name: Healthcare Data Analyst
Description: XtendWe are seeking qualified candidates for our Healthcare Data Analyst position. This position will work with our client's proprietary tools to analyze large volumes of hospital data. The candidates must employ various technical data manipulation techniques to analyze large complex data sets, identify data patterns, data mine, etc. Through training, candidates must learn and apply relevant regulations to compile data sets. Candidates must be able to communicate results of the analysis to project managers.  Xtend Healthcare, a premier consulting firm established in 2009, is seeking professionals to fulfill a specific need at one of our key clients of EY (Ernst & Young) within its Indianapolis healthcare advisory practice. These full-time positions offer a competitive salary and an attractive benefits package. The positions are long-term with no scheduled end date. Many current Xtend Healthcare employees have been contracted in similar roles at EY for multiple years -- some well over a decade.  EY is a globally recognized professional services firm and its Indianapolis healthcare advisory practice serves a variety of healthcare clients nationally. EY is looking to expand its existing team of Xtend Healthcare data analysts. Xtend Healthcare employees who act in these contracted roles have data analytics, informatics or business backgrounds. Some individuals do occasionally travel for work but travel is not required by all. Candidates are expected to work daily in EY's downtown Indianapolis, Indiana office location.  EY offers our team members a highly inclusive, flexible work environment. Benefits also include the opportunity to develop and build upon deep technical skills, healthcare industry knowledge, and consulting skills through on-the-job training. The services provided include assisting their clients in complying with Medicare, Medicaid and other regulatory requirements, in addition to helping them receive the appropriate amount of reimbursement from these programs.  1. Analyze large volumes of hospital data.  2. Employ various techniques to analyze large complex data sets: Data manipulationDana miningIdentifying data patterns 3. Learn and apply relevant regulations to compile data sets.  4. Communicate results of analysis succinctly to project managers.Bachelor's Degree in Business, Informatics, Data Analytics, Finance, Accounting, or a related field.MUST HAVE:2+ years experience in Business, Informatics, Data Analytics, Finance, Accounting, or a related field.Bachelor's degree.Intermediate level proficiency with Microsoft Excel required, with Microsoft Access, SQL or other database software experience recommended.OTHER HELPFUL EDUCATION OR EXPERIENCE: Experience with Medicare or Medicaid reimbursement, including cost reports, Medicare DSH and/or Medicare bad debts, is a significant advantageKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS and ABILITIES: Intermediate level proficiency with Microsoft Excel (required) with Microsoft Access, SQL or other database software experience (recommended).Acute attention to detail and strong analytical skills (required).Strong written and verbal communication skills.Ability to employ critical thinking skills and work independently while also working well within a team environment.Receptiveness to differing views and ideas with the ability to apply industry-specific concepts.Highly adaptable to changing circumstances and/or directives in day-to-day priorities.Ability to perform well on frequent repetitive tasks while continually improving skills and competencies.Willingness to travel occasionally (plus).Successful reference check, background check and drug screening (required). All offers of employment are contingent on standard background checks. Navient and certain of its affiliated companies are federal, state and/or local government contractors. Should this position support a federal government contract, now or in the future, the successful candidate will be subject to a background check conducted by the U.S. Government to determine eligibility and suitability for federal contract employment for public trust or sensitive positions. Positions that support state and/or local contracts also may require additional background checks to determine eligibility and suitability.EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Protected Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity.  Navient Corporation and its subsidiaries are not sponsored by or agencies of the United States of America.  Navient is a drug free workplace.  Full-time  Indianapolis, IN  Mar 21, 2018

We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We're looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world. As a data-centric and performance driven organization, this is a critical role within Valve+Meter. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Summary: You found us.  Or maybe we found you. Either way, welcome to TradeRev. TradeRev is using innovation, technology, and creativity to make car sales fair and easy for everyone. Wholesale auto auctions have been the same in-person, manual environment since the beginning of time just like bookstores, ordering a taxi and buying music (cue the crickets and tumbleweed). Our mobile app creates a digital marketplace where car dealers can launch and participate in live, real-time auctions right from the palm of their hands. Our technology makes buying and selling cars simple, convenient and transparent for everyone involved. And our people make the process easy, smooth and fun every step of the way.  Startup attitude. Big Company Fuel.  Now backed by one of the largest automotive auction companies in the world, TradeRevs goal is to be the worlds leading marketplace for buying and selling used vehicles. How do we get there? Well, we start by pushing the envelope of cloud technology and executing on an aggressive product pipeline packed with first-of-their-kind ideas and innovations. Add the support, resources and broad capabilities of our parent company, and were able to deliver integrated products and services that no competitor can begin to match. So, as we set our sights to dominate North America and expand TradeRevs reach around the globe, the only thing were missing is you.  Speed. Swagger. Service.  At TradeRev, were a high-tech, high-energy, lightning-fast environment where no two projects, customers or workdays are ever the same. As we see it, boredom breeds predictability and fortune favours the bold. We are coding rock stars, digital ninjas and the most fearless sales and operations teams on the planet. Were designers, data analysts, marketers, project managers, trainers and even a few lawyers thrown in for good measure. Were not all car people but we share an obsession for customer service and passion for disrupting the status quo. Addicted to challenge? Thrive on change? Put your creativity, personality and talent to work and help us transform one of the largest, most dynamic industries in the world. Job Description:You will:Design and develop sales and business intelligence reporting using reporting tools such as Tableau.Use gathered data, create accessible and simplistic presentation reports leading to actionable insights.Conduct research to identify and/or analyze trends/issues that may lead to resolving potential or current business intelligence challengesMonitor, optimize and resolve performance issues of different dashboards.Build reports and dashboards using different data sources such as My SQL, SQL, Salesforce, Excel, and Google Analytics.Perform in-depth analysis of research information for the purpose of finding opportunities, developing proposals and recommendations for use by management, sales, finance and others.Collaborate with business partners to collect and compile information; find key patterns; and combine these analytical findings in support of strategy development.Collaborate with sales, sales operations, and accounting to define data requirements, dedicatedly assess reporting needs and identify key metrics to assess business performance.Assist in developing executive-level presentations and communication that clearly links Corporate sales strategy analysis and recommendations using data.Develop an understanding of how our clients operate and how technology can be utilized to create new value streams.Success Metrics:Bachelors degree or equivalent with preferred majors in statistics, economics, business, computer science or another quantitative-focused degree.4-6 years experience in reporting in Tableau, Salesforce, SQL in an analyst role in business intelligence, analytics and/or reporting.Superior data analysis, visualization and reporting skills.Detail oriented individual with high desire to organize and structure tasks and processesExceptional problem solving, analytical and organizational skills.Experience with scripting languages such as SQL, Bash or PythonPower user in conducting business analytics using Microsoft Office applications (particularly expert capabilities for Excel) and summarizing the data into digestible parts to different audiences.Demonstrated project management ability to meet short deadlines and execute against competing or changing priorities as well as concurrent projects.Comfortable working both independently and in a team environment.Ability to communicate complex ideas in a clear, concise manner both verbally and in writing.Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management within the company, customers, and partners.Highly driven and motivated individual who can work in a company in hyper-growth. We thank all interested candidates; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  TradeRev is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity.  TradeRev is committed to providing employment regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status.

Name: Sr Analyst
Description: *45366BR***Responsibilities:** Are you searching for a challenging opportunity leading support activities and application delivery projects within a fast-moving team utilizing modern Design practices and web technologies?  Medicines Development IT (MD IT) serves a strategic function within Lilly?s Medicines Development Unit (MDU). As part of its Digital MDU and Customer Engagement objectives, MD IT seeks to help increase the speed and to optimize medicine delivery to our patients through clinical trials.  MD IT?s Lilly Indianapolis Design Center works across the company to deliver unparalleled customer experiences to users both internal and external to Lilly. The team achieves this through tight partnership between User Experience Designers and our IT Development Team utilizing modern web technologies. The team focuses on 3 major areas: The ?Lilly TrialGuide? program, which through www.LillyTrialGuide.com engages and educates patients and caregivers on Clinical Research, and helps them to find a Lilly Clinical TrialOur internal ?Cue? program, which delivers accelerated capabilities for internal MDU personnel, particularly around modern SearchFulfilling project needs inside and outside the MDU where User-Centric design methods and/or modern web technology capabilities are needed Our team intentionally seeks out Innovation opportunities, striving to either bring value breakthroughs or ?fail fast?, then move on to the next opportunity.  This position will have dual roles of both leading our support activities for our Lilly TrialGuide and Cue programs, and also acting as Business Analyst for various application development and delivery projects. General Role Expectations: + Partner with other LIDC leaders and team members to execute and improve our services, internal culture, and delivery.  + Develop relationships within and an understanding of the business and IT groups with whom we work to best deliver quick, valuable solutions.  + Anticipate needs from MDU business areas and our LIDC team, and propose opportunities to improve and evolve. Then lead assessment, alternatives, recommendations, and execution of solutions.  + Benchmark externally to identify potential additional technologies and methods to improve our LIDC program and our business partner processes and overall effectiveness. Support Lead: + Help define the strategy and processes for operational support of applications and platforms for which our LIDC group is responsible  + Lead operational support activities within the LIDC, including being the primary communication point for system users  + Continually assess the effectiveness of our support processes, and evolve and improve our program as needed Business Consultant: + Work across business partner IT, end user, Designer/UX, and other groups to define and prioritize requirements for solutions, for multiple projects at the same time  + Ensure business and technical requirements are properly translated into actionable Agile User Stories for our development teams  + Partner with project Scrum Masters to orchestrate execution of LIDC projects  + Quickly understand a business area and its priorities, anticipate needs, and pro-actively propose solutions *Req ID:**45366BR*Additional Skills/Preferences:** + ITIL Service Management training and certifications (e.g., Foundations, and more advanced courses)  + Experience leading strategic and operational IT system support activities, particularly in coordination with an IT vendor  + Passionate desire to work closely and intensely within our onsite team Agile/Scrum environment, completing tasks outside of traditional role boundaries if needed to help the team reach its goals  + Demonstrated ability to influence key business partner leaders and other IT groups  + Experience with front-end (user-facing) design or development of web sites and apps  + Experience with and understanding of public-facing digital marketing techniques and best practices  + Solid experience working with people in other countries and cultures, and appropriately challenging country personnel and regulation interpretations when needed  + Experience within the clinical trials / clinical research business areas  + Experience within the clinical trials / clinical research business areas  + Agile Project Management experience strongly preferred *Additional Information:** + Position is based in Indianapolis  + Some global travel may be needed (less than 10%)  + Lilly is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status *Workplace Arrangement:** Local *Title:** UX Business Analyst - IT *Job Category:** Information Technology *Basic Qualifications:** + Bachelor's Degree  + 2+ years in IT Business Analyst/Integrator roles, delivering IT Solutions, or supporting IT systems.  + Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the United States. Lilly does not anticipate providing sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B or TN status) for this employment position *Company Overview:** At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 39,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We?re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world *City:** Indianapolis *Country:**USA*State / Province:** Indiana *Region:** North America

Name: CLM Business Analyst
Description: Determine develops innovative software that the worlds most successful companies rely on to improve the effectiveness of their sales and contracting processes. Our guided selling, sales configuration, and contract lifecycle management solutions support the Global 2000 and growing mid-size firms in closing billions of dollars worth of business each year.  The Business Consultant acts as an interface between our clients business teams and our product teams. The consultant implements software solutions by adapting to the clients needs and adjusting capabilities of the software. This includes configuring the tool based on functional specifications, training users, and providing advice to clients on best practice processes and areas for improvement.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Partner with clients to design, develop/configure, and build solutions to help them reimagine and reshape their source-to-pay process (S2P).Conduct thorough business process analysis and provide guidance.Deliver enterprise solutions as part of the implementation team.Provide client configuration training utilizing Determines implementation methodology.Collaborate with internal and external team(s) through problem definition, issue identification and work plan development.Support change management activities to prepare the client for deployment and adoption.REQUIREMENTS Bachelors Degree in Business Administration, Contract Law, Supply Chain, Accounting, Finance, related field or applicable work experienceMinimum 3 years of relevant work experienceExperience with process design, demonstration of thought leadership and implementation of process improvementHigh degree of integrityStrong familiarity with project management processes and methodologyAnalytical thinking and problem solving, ability to effectively identify business issues and opportunities, assess proposed solutions and meet stakeholder needs.Ability to present ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language.Excellent written, oral, interpersonal, and presentation skills.S2P software/ERP system knowledge a plusUnderstanding of procurement, strategic sourcing, and contract management business processes a plusPer Determine policy, all third parties desiring to assist or assisting Determine with recruiting and/or related processes must work strictly through the Director of Global Human Resources at hr@determine.com. The Determine Director of Global Human Resources is the only employee with any authority to direct, or receive information from, such third parties and no other Determine employee or related party has the authority or agency to direct any such actions or receive any such information.

Name: Business Intelligence Manager
Description: Business Intelligence Manager  BCforward is seeking a BI Manager for a direct hire role in Indianapolis.  The Business Intelligence Manager is responsible for leading the Business Intelligence Developers and Reporting Workbench Analysts in identifying, designing, developing, distributing, and maintaining the advanced data and analytics reporting needs of the network. They serve as a resource and mentor to other team members often taking on larger and more complex projects. This position requires in-depth knowledge and experience in BI development, analytics and data presentation/visualization. Must have extensive SQL development skills and understand the concepts of various databased management systems models. The ideal candidate is customer focused, creative, and has excellent analysis, problem solving, and communication skills. This professional will lead and/or participate in gathering and translating business analytics requirements into BI technical solutions. This position works collaboratively with IT members, vendors, and business unit management/staff on a regular basis so advanced business analytics can be applied to improve patient care, operations, or financial outcomes. May be responsible for designing, configuring, debugging, and troubleshooting Community Health Network's various data warehouse platforms and applications. REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: 4+ years of experience in BI development, analytics and data presentation.  Experience with Microsoft SQL Server technology stack (e.g. SSAS, SSIS, SSRS & SPROC)  Experiences preferred: Healthcare  Experiences considered a plus: Oracle SQL, Data warehouse, SAP Business Objects, Crystal Reports, QlikView, Qlik Sense, MS Power BI. REQUIRED EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related business field, strongly preferred. PREREQUISITE SKILL: 4+ years using BI best practices, methodologies, relational structures, dimensional data modeling, and data warehouse and reporting techniques  Proficient in MS SQL Server using T-SQL, writing Stored Procedures, and demonstrated experience with report writing tools  Knowledge of SQL to write complex, highly-optimized queries across large volumes of data  Proficient in one or more of the following: Microsoft Business Intelligence, Oracle Business Intelligence, Tableau, Hadoop, Qlik, Microsoft BI, or SAP Business Objects platforms  Experience with OLAP/MOLAP/ROLAP/HOLAP technology and BI development  Experience or knowledge of OLTP technology  Knowledge of ETL and data warehouse concepts and processes  Should have experience with source code control and have a strong understanding of concepts and the ability to reverse engineer reports  Knowledge in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)  Proven ability to be flexible and motivated, and to work well both independently, and in a team environment, in a high pressure environment with changing priorities  Ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, be flexible and manage multiple projects  Excellent documentation and communication skills  Experience in creating IT documents for knowledge base, user guides, and other various communications systems  Knowledge of healthcare application data sources and data analysis cores (Utilization, HEDIS, Patient Risk Stratification, Medical Risk Adjustment/HCC Management, Clinical Access) a plus  Experience with agile software development is a plus ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Coordinates in-depth analysis of current programs by timeframe assigned. Appropriately communicates results.Determines appropriate information source, process, and audit to pass information to clients by timeframe assigned. Coordinates data feed and integration of information into the appropriate Business Intelligence system.Special projects are completed on a timely basis and supported by necessary documentation.Hospital and Department policies and procedures regarding performance, conduct, attendance, confidentiality, hospitality and other general items are adhered to in an appropriate manner.Maintains current and up-to-date skills in the use and application of all available tools that enhance performance and optimize productivity.Trains Business Intelligence Analysts on the use and application of all available tools that enhance performance and optimize productivityCommunicates with team members regarding best methods to utilize systems based on own experiences and provides training in these systems to other staff both inside and outside the department.Recognizes the importance of developing relationships with customers, leadership, peers as crucial to success as an individual, team and department.Directs staff including setting priorities, coordination and reporting of group activities.Plans and organizes the various functions under his control to insure adequate staffing, and develops training/education programs for staff development.Fulfills departmental requirements in terms of providing work coverage and administrative notification during periods of personnel illness, vacation or educationRequisition staff replacements and additions. Interview applicants and hire new employees. Orient staff to department and enterprise policies. Interested candidates please send resume in Word format Please reference job code 63385 when responding to this ad.

Name: License & Data Analyst
Company: City Of Indianapolis and Marion County
Description: Position Summary This position is open to internal Business and Neighborhood Services candidates only  Position is responsible for performing licensing and data analysis functions for the Department of Business and Neighborhood Services. This position performs intake, analysis and issuance of license applications for various industries and events regulated by the City. This position also receives and analyzes data as well as creating relevant reports. Review and analysis of applications and data involves sensitive documents and a level of discretion. Position provides research of license data and information relative to licensed and unlicensed businesses. Position will assist in communication regarding enforcement of all licenses, specifically hotel and shared mobility licenses. This position is responsible for all licensing data analysis for the Department.  Position Responsibilities  Analyzes all data related to licensing, specifically hotels and shared mobility and creates reports to easily identify pertinent information.  Works with internal and external stakeholders to obtain and process data and reports.  Maintains a current awareness of the latest technology and data development trends in the industry and their applicability to the needs and requirements of the licensing section.  Demonstrates continuous effort to improve operations, streamline work processes, and work cooperatively and jointly to provide quality seamless customer service. Investigates questions and complains regarding problems with licenses or the license process and coordinate  resolution.  Communicates with internal and external customers regarding issues, problems, and procedures with cases  under review, issued license, and inspections.  Review license applications and related documents for completeness and compliance with applicable  ordinances, requests required inspections, and issues licenses.  Processes customer application and data accurately and quickly, often under pressure.  Provides assistance to applicants as well as general public to resolve issues and complete license  applications.  Reviews applications and data reports for deficiencies and works with customers to resolve  Other duties as assigned  This list of duties and responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other  duties or responsibilities that management may deem necessary from time to time. Qualifications This position is open to internal Business and Neighborhood Services candidates only  Bachelor's degree in related field of study required. One (1) year of related experience may be substituted  for each year of formal education. The ability to obtain a working knowledge and interpretation of applicable  codes, ordinances, and procedures. Must be able to think critically, specifically in observations of reported  data in order to identify anomalies, outliers and/or misinformation. Ability to prioritize and handle varied  assignments and heavy workload. Ability to review plans, documents, inspection results and specifications.  Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing on technical, complex, or controversial matters  with inspectors, applicants, contractors, and public. Ability to operate a Windows based computer and learn  various related applications. Ability to effectively use Microsoft Office. Ability to maintain accurate physical  and electronic files for retrieval. Must be able to pay close attention to details, status and laws regarding a  wide range of licenses. Must have conflict-resolution skills and an attitude of calm to allow for resolution of  difficult situations. Must be highly flexible, to be able to adjust to constantly changing work demands.  Independent Judgment  Actions are controlled by established City policies and procedures, and federal, state and municipal codes.  Independent judgment will be exercised in determining priorities; evaluating compliance; interpreting  applicable codes and ordinances to ensure proper review and issuance of permits; evaluation complaints  and recommending proper courses of action for resolutions and handling public/contractor inquiries. Errors  in judgment could cause significant embarrassment and/or liability. Incumbent would interact with section, division, department and City employees, as well as with  contractors, engineers, other governmental agencies and members of the general public. Working  relationships require a high degree of tact, diplomacy and persuasiveness.SDL2017

Name: Client Services Technical Analyst - Senior
Description: Cummins is a place big enough to coach and develop a global workforce and create the world’s leading clean, engine technology. We’re also small enough for you to find your fit and personal passion with a team of dependable, innovative thinkers who are developing their careers within a diverse, inclusive, empowering environment. Learn more about this role and how you can begin Working Right. Our Cummins Business Services Unit delivers reliable, durable, high performing products to our global partners. Working in an innovative space, you’ll develop high tech solutions that will fuel your advanced career skill set and empower you to own your career. Our integrated businesses demand the talents and creativity of individuals with a wide range of skills and experience. This is an exciting opportunity in Indianapolis, Indiana for a Client Services Technical Analyst – Senior. Cummins USA is where you can work on industry leading engineering projects such as New Product Development, Value Package Introduction and Systems Product Validation. Skills and Experience Required:5 years of experience working with similar technologies:Apple Certified Mac and iOS Technician certification for 3 to 5 years.Creation, testing, and deployment of operating system for MacOS based Cummins Global Desktop (CGD)Create and maintain work instructions for imaging and troubleshooting. Work with hardware vendor on system management interfaces, equipment specifications, and roadmaps.Integration of systems and tools into the Cummins environment, including readiness and processes.Define the hardware processes for procurement, refresh, and repair of Apple products.Maintain and routinely update all Class 1 software (standard software installed on all CGD devices) to ensure security and technology is up to date. Work with the software certification and delivery teams on delivery of software specific to MacOS devices.Interfacing with cybersecurity, mobile device support teams, and collaboration teams on device management for Apple devices.Assist with providing improvements to customer service (e.g. Apple store like experience).Manage 6-Sigma and 7-Step projects related to the CGD environment. Work directly with vendors on escalated issues. Provide advanced technical support to level 1-3 Desktop Support groups.Provide advanced escalation for executive device support issues, both to local support teams and direct to executives as needed.Maintain a collaborative workspace to interface with people using Apple devices.Able to communicate complex technical concepts to people of all skill levels Able to work with vendors and communications outlets to research technical solutions, and recommend future direction Solution Design - Creates and defines the solution design complete with instrumentation and measurement, using Cummins IT processes, standards and tools, version control, and build and test automation to synthesize diagrams, models and documentation in order to build a solution that meets buildability, business, technical, security, governance and compliance requirements.Solution Functional Fit Analysis - Composes and decomposes a system into its component parts using procedures, tools and work aides for the purpose of studying how well the component parts were designed, purchased and configured to interact holistically to meet business, technical, security, governance and compliance requirements.Solution Modeling - Creates, designs and formulates models, diagrams and documentation using Cummins IT processes, standards, tools, version control, and build and test automation to meet business, technical, security, governance and compliance requirements.Solution Configuration - Configures, creates and tests a solution for commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) applications using Cummins IT processes, standards and tools, version control, and build and test automation to meet business, technical, security, governance and compliance requirements.Data Modeling - Creates, writes and tests data models, test scripts and build scripts using Cummins IT processes, standards and tools, version control, and build and test automation to meet business, technical, security, governance and compliance requirements.Performance Tuning - Conceptualizes, analyzes and solves application, database and hardware problems using Cummins IT processes, standards and tools, version control, and build and test automation to meet business, technical, security, governance and compliance requirements.Solution Validation Testing - Validates a configuration item change or solution using the IT Operating Model (ITOM), including the SDLC standards, tools and metrics, to ensure that it works as designed and meets customer requirements.Customer focus - Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.Manages complexity - Making sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems.Global perspective - Taking a broad view when approaching issues, using a global lens.Optimizes work processes - Knowing the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement.Manages conflict - Handling conflict situations effectively, with a minimum of noise. Your impact will happen in these and other ways:Provides application or infrastructure technical expertise, analysis and specifications for IT systems to meet business requirements in accordance with IT architecture policies and standards; translate requirements into technical specifications, create detailed solution design, coordinate construction, installation, configuration and testing of IT systems; and identifies, troubleshoots and resolves system technical issues.Assists in creating and managing the technical specifications from which programs and configurations will be applied to create the application, infrastructure or complete solution.Assists in technical analysis of potential solutions including evaluating the technical fit and viability of commercial-of-the-shelf products versus custom built solution.Delivers solution design, adhering to standards and leveraging re-use of components.Assists in creating high level and detail design of infrastructure OR applications, interfaces, conversions, extensions, reports, and workflows while meeting architecture, security, performance, scalability, and maintainability requirements.Assists technical and infrastructure groups in understanding the solution design and specifications.Works closely with IT technical service providers to ensure outsourced work packages are delivered to specifications, meeting key parameters of quality, schedule, cost, security, performance, and scalability.Participates in formal design reviews and code reviews (where applicable) to ensure the detailed design specifications have been understood and coding standards have been adhered to by the development team(s).Leverages re-usability of component designs to reduce costs and shorten time to deliver solutionEnsures adherence to obtain efficiency in the build and deploy processes, leveraging automation where possible.Assists in the test strategy and execution of master test plan.Participates in the creation of standards, processes, procedures, and guidelines for the IT design and development community as well work instructions or ‘runbooks’ used for end-user support.Analyzes and revises existing systems and documentation to identify remediation or improvements in the application or infrastructure solution.Provides level 3 support for critical issues.Required Education, Licenses or CertificationsCollege, university, or equivalent degree in Information Technology, Business or a related subject required.Compensation and BenefitsBase salary rate commensurate with experience. Additional benefits vary between locations and include options such as our 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, Cash Balance Pension Plan, Medical/Dental/Life Insurance, Health Savings Account, Domestic Partners Coverage and a full complement of personal and professional benefits. Cummins and E-verifyAt Cummins, we are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer dedicated to diversity in the workplace. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, gender, color, disability, national origin, age, religion, union affiliation, sexual orientation, veteran status, citizenship, gender identity and/or expression, or other status protected by law. Cummins validates right to work using E-Verify. Cummins will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. Ready to think beyond your desk? Apply for this opportunity to start your career with Cummins today. careers.cummins.com Not ready to apply but want to learn more? Join our Talent Community to get the inside track on great jobs and confidentially connect to our recruiting team: http://connect.find.ly/cummins

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionWe are seeking an experienced, highly motivated data analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate has auto insurance related experience with the ability to manage and deliver actionable data in DMC’s underwriting departments. Areas of focus include underwriting, pricing, and profiling risk and the reduction of risk to our customers. This person will have excellent technical and communication skills and will be asked to be a self-starter in building out DMC’s data capabilities within the Underwriting departments with both inward- and outward-facing applications.  Further, this candidate will exhibit strong analytical and investigative skills, a holistic understanding of the commercial insurance process, and a desire to serve our customers with a best-in-class, value-driven insurance product.  Lastly, the ideal candidate will bolster and add to DMC’s unique culture – a workplace built on enthusiasm, entrepreneurship, integrity, communication, proactive problem solving, and a genuine passion for helping our customers and agents. Insurance industry experience is preferred.Bachelor’s Degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science, information technology or related field.Ideal candidate will have proven experience leveraging data capabilities to solve business problems in an insurance setting.Proficiency with reporting tools including Excel, business intelligence and analytical tools.Strong analytical skills with ability to collect, organizing (cleaning, transforming, modeling) and disseminate actionable business observationsExcellent project management skills.Customer service orientation, strong listening skills, ability to present findings.Travel, as needed (0-10% of time) to visit key brokers/customers/prospects, support executive initiatives, and participate in industry events/trade shows if requestedMust be a self-starter with ability to manage time in a fast-paced environment, prioritize critical tasks, communicate with management on status, and deliver on objectives in a timely fashion.Must be able to work proactively in independent settings, as well as work collaboratively with a team.PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTSAbility to perform standard office tasks, including prolonged computer work.Ability to move about customer worksites or industry tradeshows and perform customary inspection or set-up tasks.Must be able to regularly lift and/or carry laptop computer with associated equipment weighing about 25 pounds. Name: PeopleSoft HCM Analyst
Description: Onebridge is actively seeking a Peoplesoft HCM Application Analyst located in Indianapolis, IN. Name: Senior Analyst - Cerner Millennium
Description: Atos SE (Societas Europaea) is a leader in digital services with pro forma annual revenue of circa € 12 billion and circa 100,000 employees in 72 countries. Serving a global client base, the Group provides Consulting & Systems Integration services, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations, Big Data & Cyber-security solutions, as well as transactional services through Worldline, the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. With its deep technology expertise and industry knowledge, the Group works with clients across different business sectors: Defense, Financial Services, Health, Manufacturing, Media, Utilities, Public sector, Retail, Telecommunications, and Transportation.  Atos is focused on business technology that powers progress and helps organizations to create their firm of the future. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and is listed on the Euronext Paris market. Atos operates under the brands Atos, Atos Consulting, Atos Worldgrid, Bull, Canopy, Unify and Worldline.  Position Title:  Senior Analyst - Cerner Millennium  Location:  Remote, US Wide  Core Responsibilities:  Serve as Senior Electronic Health Record (EHR) subject matter expert for the provision of any combination of two or more Cerner Millennium Clinical Solutions (SurgiNet; SurgiNet ANES; CareNet or PharmNet). Scope of duties include all aspects of implementing and subsequent operational support of Cerner Millennium. Mentors junior team members on product functionality, package validation as well as application solution build activities etc.Consistently demonstrates skills with thorough documentation in customer issue cases.Participates in Domain validation; package testing ; application break/fix resolution ; design change build/testing as approved by customer and other application support related activities as assigned.Serves as a Cerner Millennium SurgiNet/SurgiNet Anesthesia Subject Matter Expert in the delivery of services including but not limited to:Consults with client on workflow design; functional specifications, design, build and test changes to workflow logic in response to requested changes; provides education for build and maintenance of master tables from the EHR databaseDevelops and/or updates test scripts for all system implementations, changes and upgrades.Participates in system functional and integrated testing as assigned.Participates in change control process meetings and if fully compliant with Atos Change Management processes.Develops internal WIKI support articles/troubleshooting tipsheets for Cerner Millennium Solution analysts and Atos’ Healthcare National Service Desk.Provides knowledge transition to client staff and/or Cerner Millennium Solution teams and other sub-practice service teams to perform daily, weekly and monthly system maintenance and monitoring to ensure the good health of the systems (if applicable).Works collaboratively with all Atos Service Delivery teams to achieve high customer satisfaction levels for services delivered. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent healthcare and/or technical certification/licensing required. Registered Nurse highly desired.3-5 years of practical experience in the Cerner Millennium SurgiNet/SurgiNet ANES or Supply Chain Management required.3+ years experience in EHR system related implementations and/or application support in a healthcare environment required, hospital experience preferred. Skills & Requirements:Analytical ability to identify, analyze and evaluate market changes, create solutions to difficult administrative, technical or human situations.Effective written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills for contact with internal and external customers and peers to obtain and interpret a variety of information based on knowledge of departmental practices, hospital policies and programs and specific technical and regulatory knowledge.Must possess the ability to learn new things in a variety of ways (i.e., self learning and/or virtual classroom setting) and think innovatively for solutions to business and technical problems related to patient care/record process flow.Ability to participate on multiple projects simultaneously and remotely.Superior organizational skills.Intermediate to expert level skill in use of standard Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint.Ability to travel as required by client engagement and as otherwise defined by the Atos’ Digital Healthcare Solutions Leadership team. This work will include: Reconciliation development using established execution strategy, to continue to refine, update, and build reconciliation inventory.Program Management services to integrate, coordinate and manage all activities needed to support services required.Build repeatable and sustainable reconciliations: workbooks, workflow for variances, and management reports.Training to government employees to sustain the reconciliation process.Develop and support implementing a change management strategy and plan. Plan will include the strategy for operationalizing reconciliations, defining roles and responsibilities, identifying centralized and decentralized functions, and defining resources required to research and resolve variances.Ensure Management Internal Control Program (MICP) is documented in iControl and/or FISCAMAdvise, develop, and support a configuration management plan for the end state solution/s.Provide Ensure Management Internal Control Program (MICP) is documented in iControl and/or FISCAM audit consulting services and innovative approaches for accomplishing performance objectives to ensure developed processes and reconciliations meet audit standards. Name: Food Microbiology Analyst
Description: EMSL Analytical, Inc., one of the largest environmental testing firms in the United States, is currently seeking a Food Microbiology Analyst for its Indianapolis, IN location. The candidate will be experienced in a commercial microbiology laboratory setting. The position will be primarily responsible for food microbiology preparation and analysis. The incumbent will be able to work with a group of analysts and technicians to ensure quality data, timely results, and compliance to ISO 17025 and internal standards. The contract testing laboratory environment is fast-paced and requires attention to detail, high-level organizational skills, and the ability to multitask. This job also requires the ability to sit or stand for long periods of time. Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Media Preparation  Sample Set up  Sample preparation and pH Adjustments  Documentation of sample preparation and analytical activities  Quantitative and Qualitative Analysis for Food to include: Aerobic Plate Count, Total Coliform / E. coli, Staphylococcus aureus, Yeast & Mold, Salmonella, Listeria, E. coli O157:H7.  Confirmation analysis of presumptive and suspect isolates, requiring critical and flexible thinking approaches  Conduct specialty projects as needed: Shelf Life Studies, Challenge Studies, FDA Import Detention Projects.  Laboratory organization, supply inventory, calibrations, cleaning and maintenance of lab equipment.  Candidate will be required to cross train in Environmental Microbiology (microscopy) and willing to cross train in additional areas as needed Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree preferably in Microbiology, Biology, Food Science, or other Life Science discipline  1-2 years previous commercial lab experience is desired  Experience with aseptic technique, food microbiology, or other culture-based microbiology lab experience required  Must be able to work independently and with a team  Candidate must be able to distinguish colors in order to perform analysis  Must be able to work in a fast-paced setting, multi-task, and prioritize assignments  Must be willing to cross train in other disciplines ( Environmental Microbiology)  Must have good communication, computer, typing and organizational skills.  Must be willing to work over-time and weekends, as needed. Available Shift: Monday to Friday 11:00 a.m. to 7:30 p.m., extra hours and/or weekend work may be required to meet business demands.  As the nation's leading environmental testing firm, EMSL's network of nationwide laboratories has been providing quality analytical services since 1981. We offer a wide array of analytical testing services to support environmental investigations focused on asbestos, microbiology, lead paint, environmental chemistry, indoor air quality, industrial hygiene and food testing. Additionally, we also provide materials testing, characterization, and forensic laboratory services for a wide range of commercial, industrial, regulatory, and law enforcement clients.  EMSL Analytical, Inc. is a stable and growing company that offers the opportunity to become a part of a close knit team where you can advance within and develop professionally. EMSL laboratories are throughout the U.S. and international with laboratory locations in Canada.  EMSL offer full time benefits: medical, dental, 401(k), FSA, voluntary benefits, life insurance, paid holidays and paid time off.  To find out more about EMSL Analytical, Inc. please visit our website at: www.emsl.com  EOE including Veterans and Disabled

Name: Application Support Analyst (Data Management)
Description: Position Location: Carmel, IndianaABOUT MISO MISO manages the electricity super highway in the Central U.S. Through use of groundbreaking research and advanced technology, our highly skilled employees ensure power flows reliably to 42 million Americans. We make certain that the right amount of electricity is generated and delivered dependably and cost-effectively every minute of every day. Name: ERP Analyst 1
Description: Job Category: Maintenance  At Republic Airline, our mission is to provide a safe, clean and reliable flying experience. We believe this is best accomplished by focusing on our vision, With the BEST people, products and performance, we will be Americas Regional Airline of choice. Republic Airline, based in Indianapolis, operates a fleet of 188 Embraer 170/175 aircraft and offers scheduled passenger service with 900 daily flights to 100 cities in 35 U.S. states, Canada, the Caribbean and Central America. The airline provides fixed-fee flights operated under our major airline partner brands of American Eagle, Delta Connection and United Express. Our 10 domiciles include CMH, DCA, EWR, IND, LGA, MCI, MIA, ORD, PHL and PIT. With more than 5,500 talented aviation professionals, Republic Airline is a great place to get your career off the runway! POSITION PURPOSE Promotes the effective use of the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system in order to streamline the organization through the use of automation and technology. ESSENTIAL DUTIESTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. · Provides support and responds to issues for unique situations related to the Companys ERP.  · Updates and maintains user guides on how to use the ERP system.  · Provides support and training to various organizations: Supply Chain, Material Services, Quality Assurance, etc. on effective use of the ERP and on other related company systems.  · Tests and/or registers defects, new requirement requests and enhancements with the ERP system and its supplier. May write up and create test environments.  · Performs acceptance testing and develops test cases for defects and enhancements to the system.  · Delivers recurrent training to the field on the use of automation and technology.  · Coordinates new requirements across functional areas.  · Responds to issues forwarded by Republic IT ticket system; provides after hours support as needed.  · Performs other duties as assigned or required. REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIESThe requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability necessary to perform this job. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE.  High school diploma or GED.  At least three years of airline experience with at least one of those years in Supply Chain or related experience.  Depending on the type of ERP support, an A&P License and RII may be required.  PREFERRED EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE  Bachelors degree or equivalent in aviation, IT systems area or equivalent. Related systems experience (RAMCO, SAP or similar system).  LANGUAGE SKILLS  Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions,  technical and procedure manuals. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and  procedure manuals. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or associates of the  organization.  REASONING/PROBLEM SOLVING ABILITY  Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only  limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral,  diagram, or schedule form.  DECISION MAKING  Makes limited decisions and determines best methods to solve problems by referring to established precedents and policies. Impact of decisions is moderately low. PHYSICAL DEMANDSThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Able to move about the work environment.  Frequently required to stand, walk, sit, talk and hear. WORK ENVIRONMENTThe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an associate encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Typical conditions of an indoor office environment. Occasionally work in an open air hangar. TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS Able to travel up to 25% of the time, including overnight travel.  Republic Airline is committed to providing qualified applicants and associates reasonable accommodation, when necessary, to enable the individuals to complete the application process and/or perform the essential functions of the job. An applicant and/or associate requiring reasonable accommodation to perform any essential job function, should contact Human Resources. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP here at https://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeocselfprint_poster.pdf%E2%80%8B .Selected candidate(s) for hire must complete the following prior to employment: a criminal history report, global screen, drug screen, employment credit report and if applicable, a driving record. Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities  The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractors legal duty to furnish information.  Republic Airline, based in Indianapolis, operates a fleet of approximately 190 Embraer 170/175 aircraft and offers scheduled passenger service with 950 daily flights to 100 cities in 35 U.S. states, Canada, the Caribbean and Central America. The airline provides fixed-fee flights operated under our major airline partner brands of American Eagle, Delta Connection and United Express. The airline employs about 5,500 aviation professionals. Visit www.rjet.com at http://http//www.rjet.com/ for more information, follow the company on Instagram, Twitter and YouTube, and connect on Facebook or LinkedIn.

Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: Medxcel Facilities Management is here to lead the transformation of healthcare facilities management by incorporating a new approach to providing services. Created by healthcare, for healthcare, we have a dedicated focus on our people and customers, as well as providing tools, processes, support resources, data analytics and insource strategies that drive results.  The Pricing Analyst position is responsible for collecting and analyzing data from prospective customers and collaborating with Medxcel leadership in the development of program and pricing strategies to position the company to optimize profitability. This position will be assigned to the working location of the Central Office - Indianapolis, IN.This unique and fast-paced customer-facing role plays an integral part in strategic customer initiatives that have a significant impact on a rapidly growing organization. This position will be responsible for collecting and analyzing data from prospective customers and collaborating with Medxcel leadership in the development of program and pricing strategies to position the company to optimize profitability. This includes ensuring the requirements are interpreted correctly and identifying risks and opportunities in the data to help construct facilities management service program solutions. This position will communicate with customer financial leaders to obtain data; perform forensic analysis of the general ledger; and assess vendor service contracts, customer inventory, and labor to determine current expenses and develop pro-forma projections and other assumptions. Assist in winning new business by conducting market and customer analysis to understand the scope of the request and develop facilities management servicing program solutions that meet the needs of the customerPrepare, manipulate, and extract data and information from multiple internal and external sources and leverage to develop and execute sound pricing strategiesAssist in developing high quality projection models that incorporate complex financial and operational data to support pricing strategy and decision makingProduce in depth reporting and analysis for key business stakeholdersPreparation and analysis of financial models to quantify the projected revenue and profit on new business opportunitiesAnalyze facilities management servicing costs and conduct profitability analysis of possible pricing strategiesCustomer strategy development includes partnering with sales and collaborating with other functional areas to deliver an impressive presentationParticipate in client presentations and educate prospective customers on the breadth of services offeredEducation:Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or related fieldExperience:5 years relevant financial experiencePricing, corporate accounting, and/or financial analysis experience preferredKnowledge, Skills and Abilities:Ability to communicate and understand complex revenue streams and pricing structuresProven ability to extract insights from data and share findings in appropriate presentation formatsAbility to build, establish, and manage collaborative relationshipsAbility to be strategic and contribute to the development of creative solutions to problemsProject management skills with the ability to prioritize work and balance multiple projectsExcellent analytical and technical skills including proficiency in pro forma developmentStrong Microsoft Office suite skills; advanced Excel skills (i.e. pivot tables, macros, etc.) desirableProblem solving and critical thinking skillsStrong written and verbal communication skillsHigh energy and enthusiasm, with a strong commitment to exceeding customer expectationsFlexibility and openness to work in a variety of assignments, capacities, and rolesAbility to learn quickly, make an immediate impact, and provide value-add serviceStrong communication and interpersonal skills, displaying the ability to connect and build relationships with clients, firm leadership, and peersConfidence in professional aptitude and ability to effectively convey skills, knowledge, and qualifications to internal and external customersTeam player with a strong desire to be an active, long-term participant in the growth of the organizationEntrepreneurial spirit and belief in the opportunities that Medxcel offersInterest and passion to get involved with business and corporate developmentSome travel (up to 10%) may be required

Name: Sr. Technical Business Analyst
Description: Job CategoryFinance and Operations  Job Details  Senior Technical Business Analyst  The Pricing and Product Operations team, within Revenue Operations, is looking for a highly motivated and technically-savvy individual to join our team as a Senior Technical Business Analyst. The ideal candidate will be a driven problem solver with an innate ability to think logically, understand business needs and processes, and develop solutions that utilize both technology and process. This individual will be a self-motivated leader that can thrive in environments with multiple concurrent projects and a broad assortment of stakeholders from both technically- and business-focused teams. Description of role: The Senior Technical Business Analyst will draw from solid experience in the arena of Configure-Price-Quote (CPQ), Quote-to-Cash (Q2C,) or system administration/configuration to manage and execute on projects involving Salesforce's in-place quoting system.  The Senior Technical Business Analyst will be as comfortable creating their own solutions as they are in guiding other team members? own individual contributions. This individual will be responsible for scoping projects, generating requirements, working with stakeholders, and developing solutions. This individual will also be responsible for maintaining portions of the quoting system and will spend a significant amount of time performing boundary and system testing to validate proposed solutions and identify future risks before they occur. Responsibilities: + Effectively communicate with various stakeholders, including both IT and business users  + Prioritize, scope, and manage incoming requests involving our quoting system  + Develop and execute technical solutions that drive the quoting system forward  + Serve as a subject matter expert and stakeholder for a variety of teams  + Create, test, and implement rules for new product and quoting configurations  + Generate documentation and provide technical guidance  + Design, manage, and execute test plans for as-is and to-be configurations Required Qualifications: + Bachelor?s degree or equivalent experience required  + 5-7 years of Business Analysis experience, with additional Data or Systems Analysis a plus  + Experience with Quote-to-Cash (Q2C), Configure -Price -Quote (CPQ), or similar business processes  + Ability to stay organized, work efficiently, and deliver on commitments under tight deadlines  + Ability to prioritize and self-direct across multiple concurrent projects Desired Qualifications: + Experience with Software development or an interest in learning  + Experience with a ?Configure, Price, Quote? (CPQ) solution such as Apttus CPQ or Salesforce CPQ  + Experience with testing or Quality Assurance  + Familiarity with Project Management methodologies  + Experience with the Salesforce platform  Posting Statement  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!
