Name: Compliance Analyst
Description: Primary Responsibilities:Must be able to work in a team environment to analyze and suggest workable enhancements to overall compliance effort of Cyber Security within Generation at Duke Energy. Objectives apply both to NERC CIP Standards and internal Cyber Security Standards. -Create policies, procedures and processes that depict how new Critical Assets meet CIP requirements -Create compliance documentation for internal Cyber Security Standards -Manage CIP compliance documents for existing Critical Assets -Manage internal Cyber Security Standards compliance documents for other Generation Assets -Create and provide Asset specific training -Collect and provide evidence for audit -Perform quarterly and annual reviews as necessary -Analyze new standards language from CIP and the impact to Generation -Analyze NERC Guidelines for compliance with CIP and the impact to Generation -Work with process control administrators -Provide process control security training -Develop detailed scope and schedule for NERC CIP compliance projects. -Develop budget estimates for NERC CIP compliance projects. -Coordinate activities with support organizations for the successful completion of NERC CIP compliance projects. -Maintain accurate and current compliance documentation for the assigned NERC Reliability Standard(s) as directed by the Requirement Owner. -Provide audit responses based on direction given by Requirement Owner or SME -Ensure the accurate creation and retention of the evidence per the requirement on the appropriate schedule. -Ensure the accurate compilation of evidence in preparation for any audit or spot check. -Schedule and track annual/quarterly compliance reviews, drills and exercises -Actively monitor assigned requirements and/or compliance evidence, provides regular updates to the Requirement Owner, and immediately notifies the Requirement Owner of any issues or concerns. -Monitor standards changes and evaluate impact to the Business Unit. Determine process changes needed to maintain compliance. Personality Traits -Self Directed -Willingness to learn requirements of electric production environment -Ability to work as a bridge between corporate IT and fossil engineering Job Description for a Compliance Analyst- Basic QualificationsAbility to pass a 7 year criminal background check.Valid drivers license Ability to manage multiple sites with varying requirements, configurations, and needs.Well organized, keeps detailed recordsThe ability and willingness to work in a team environment to develop solutions.Manage and work within a structured change control environment.This job requires travel to multiple locations. Occasional overnight travel.- Desired QualificationsAssociate Degree from an accredited university or collegeFamiliar with NERC CIP standardsFive years related experience providing compliance supportControls Systems ExperienceIT Systems ExperienceWorking knowledge of Duke Energy Policies and ProceduresShould work with minimal direct supervision in an ambiguous environmentWorking knowledge of secure remote access softwares like Citrix, and administration of IT systemsWorking knowledge of the overall operating fundamentals and principles of generating station systems, equipment and processes

Name: Business Manager - Medical
Description: Robert Half Healthcare Practice has partnered with a well-known healthcare company on the North side of Indianapolis, IN to secure a full-time Medical Office Manager. The Office Manager will perform the following duties: Fulfilling a human resources role, including hiring staffAccounts payable ? Processing and paying billsCoordinating billing and depositsCreating procedures for dealing with patientsManaging daily operations of the practice while maintaining a professional workplaceInvoicing/accounts receivable ? Prepare and send monthly invoices to clients, maintain billing files and contractsMonitor employee timesheets for accuracyTracking and monitoring performance, prepare reports and maintain accurate documentation For immediate consideration, please send your resume to Keelie.ferguson@roberthalf.com Prior experience with AR, AP, and PayrollStrong organization and leadership skillsExperience using Alis for Billing and ARExperience with ADP to process payrollExperience with Excel Accountemps matches highly skilled professionals with accounting finance jobs at the best companies on a temporary and temporary-to-hire basis. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Position Description: Under direct supervision, this position is responsible for the coordination/facilitation of multiple revenue related projects (revenue, cash applications, customer service) while supporting the day to day and monthly reporting and analysis requests for the department. Coordinates the implementation of process improvements. Develops methods and procedures, which relate to manual or automated systems and makes recommendations to improve company effectiveness and efficiency. Key Job Activities: Coordinates/processes the research, reporting, analysis, testing and implementation of Billing Systems and Processes. Makes recommendations to improve/correct system processes. Researches and queries billing database and consults with appropriate Departments for resolution as needed.  Establishes key project milestones for each project.  Performs other related duties, as required or requested.

Name: Technical Analyst 3-Support
Description: As a member of the Support organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customer needs. This involves resolving post-sales non-technical customer inquiries via phone and electronic means, as well as, technical questions regarding the use of and troubleshooting for our Electronic Support Services. A primary point of contact for customers, you are responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues.  As a Sr. Support Engineer, you will be the technical interface to customers, Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and Value-Added Resellers (VARs) for resolution of problems related to the installation, recommended maintenance and use of Oracle products. Have an understanding of all Oracle products in their competencies and in-depth knowledge of several products and/or platforms. Also, you should be highly experienced in multiple platforms and be able to complete assigned duties with minimal direction from management. In this position, you will routinely act independently while researching and developing solutions to customer issues.  Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May have project lead role. 4 years experience with Core products or five years experience with Applications products and have a technical degree i.e., BS Computer Science/Management Information Systems/Science/ Engineering/Math/Physics/Chemistry with a 3.0 GPA OR (for Applications) proven professional/ technical experience, i.e., demonstrating an understanding of Applications at a functional and technical level (preferably Oracle) Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.**Job:** **Support**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *Technical Analyst 3-Support**Location:** *United States**Requisition ID:** *18001COA**Other Locations:** *US-FL,Florida-Orlando, US-CO,Colorado-Colorado Springs*

Name: Senior Consultant
Description: CliftonLarsonAllen (CLA) is not your typical public accounting firm! As a professional services firm, we have dynamic career opportunities in audit and tax, but we also offer customized accounting support for our clients on an interim and project basis. This is called our Custom Accounting Solutions Team (CAST). If flexibility, variety, entrepreneurism, and increasing your marketplace value is important to you… Keep on reading!  CAST delivers unique custom accounting solutions when and where it’s needed. We provide flexibility without sacrificing quality. Our clients, both public and private businesses, say they appreciate how we roll up our sleeves and work alongside them, using our years of experience for their benefit. Common roles we fill are CFO, Controller, Accounting Manager, Internal Auditor, VP Finance, or Financial Reporting Manager to name a few.  We offer opportunities for traditionally qualified CPAs to utilize their talents in non-traditional ways in a role we call our Senior Consultant… Our Senior Consultants typically have less than 10 years of accounting, audit, technology or financial leadership experience and really enjoy servicing clients’ needs with a hands on approach. With the freedom to pick and choose your engagements, you allow yourself the ability to enjoy your career AND your life.  At CLA CAST, you can build the career YOU want.  Looking for Consultants to work for $35-45/hr. Job RequirementsExperience: Minimum of 7 years of work experience, including Big 4 or other similar public accounting experience. Industry experience as accounting manager, financial analyst, internal auditor, etc.Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or related fieldCertifications/Licenses: CPA preferredAn ideal Senior Consultant also possesses:Experience fixing things! Designing/improving accounting processes such as: monthly close, management and financial reporting, budgeting, forecasting, consolidations, shared services or application outsourcing and system implementationsExceptional interpersonal skills. We want someone with the capability to gain the confidence and respect of senior executives and team members without needing to be hand-held or requiring supervision.A strong client services orientation including the ability to take an active and hands on approach in executing engagements to exceed client expectations… Our Engagement Directors hit the ground running, provide value, and take pride in their work!Ability to travel is a big plus – The more open you are to travel, the more opportunities we can present to you!

Description: Additional Job InformationTitle: Financial Analyst City, State: Indianapolis, IN Location: AHMSC 4040 MSC Department: Healthcare Accounting Additional Job Details: FT Days About UsAscension is a faith-based healthcare organization dedicated to transformation through innovation across the continuum of care. As the largest non-profit health system in the U.S. and the world’s largest Catholic health system, Ascension is committed to delivering compassionate, personalized care to all, with special attention to persons living in poverty and those most vulnerable. In FY2017, Ascension provided more than $1.8 billion in care of persons living in poverty and other community benefit programs. Ascension includes approximately 165,000 associates and 34,000 aligned providers. Ascension’s Healthcare Division operates more than 2,600 sites of care – including 153 hospitals and more than 50 senior living facilities – in 22 states and the District of Columbia, while its Solutions Division provides a variety of services and solutions including physician practice management, venture capital investing, investment management, biomedical engineering, facilities management, clinical care management, information services, risk management, and contracting through Ascension’s own group purchasing organization.Job DescriptionJob Summary: The Financial Analyst performs analysis and reporting regarding financial operations and information. Prepares reports based on findings, including health care costs, provider contracts, debt capacity, revenue and profitability.Assists with budget preparation and financial planning processes. Name: Oracle Hospitality PMS Implementation Consultant
Description: Entry-level implementation professional who analyzes customer needs , configures the solution, and installs it at the customer site.  Ensure the solution meets specifications and functions per customer specific operational work flow for multiple concepts, users, and service models. Resolve any gaps in functionality. Train the staff on the use of the new solution, and take the site live on the system after everything has been configured and everyone is trained. Ensure a smooth transition to the new system. Answer operational and application questions and consult the customer in a manner to transfer ownership of the system to the customer. After "go-live", provide technical support to the customer.  0 to 2 years of experience relevant to the role. Ability to communicate effectively and build rapport with team members and clients. Ability to travel as needed. Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.*Oracle Hospitality - PMS Implementation Consultant* PMS Implementation Consultants analyze customer needs, configure the solution, and install the product at the customer site. Our Implementation Consultants also provide client training on the PMS systems.  Our Implementation Consultants ensure that our PMS solutions meet all of the specifications and functions that are unique to each of our Hospitality clients. Implementation Consultants resolve any gaps in Product functionality and train our clients how to use the new product. They are also responsible for taking the client live on the system after everything has been configured and everyone is trained. Implementation Consultants are accountable for ensuring a smooth transition and positive user experience. They are available to answer operational and application questions during the implementation process and after "go-live". They are subject matter experts in the POS products. Our Implementation Consultants are full time, Oracle employees and enjoy our best in class benefits and growth opportunities.  _Job Requirements_  This role requires 2 years of overall experience in an applicable role as an IT or PMS Deployment Engineer or as an experienced user of the*Opera Property Management or similar products*. Candidates must have the ability to communicate effectively and build rapport with team members and clients.*This position requires 90% travel. The ability to travel as needed which can include weekends and holidays is a must.* Candidates can be based anywhere in the Continental US close to a large, metropolitan airport. Training in the Opera Products will be provided at our Columbia, Maryland location.  Preference is given to individuals which have the below skills and knowledge 2 years or more experience working in the Hospitality Industry (Hotels and Restaurants)Experience as user of POS Systems helpfulExperience as user of Opera Property management such as but not limited to (PMS, S&C, OXI, IFC, OVOS)Technical experience as it relates to installing Hardware and troubleshooting that HardwareKnowledge of Cloud based software systems*Job:** **Consulting**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *Oracle Hospitality - PMS Implementation Consultant**Location:** *United States**Requisition ID:** *18001AEG*

Name: Manufacturing Systems Analyst
Description: Job Title:Manufacturing Systems AnalystJob Description:JOIN THE TEAM THAT’S POWERING PROGRESS Building cities. Driving commerce. Saving lives. For nearly 100 years, Allison Transmission has powered the vehicles and technology that move our world forward.  What powers us? Our employees. From the first person hired by James Allison in 1915 to the thousands across the globe who work for Allison today, we’re driving progress everywhere because we employ top talent worldwide.  This is an exciting opportunity in Indianapolis, IN for a Manufacturing Systems Analyst. Learn more about this role and how you can begin driving your career forward!  The Manufacturing Systems Analyst is responsible for maintaining the manufacturing systems deployed in Allison Transmission Inc.’s (ATI) North American and International plants. The Manufacturing Systems Analyst will work closely with the Manufacturing Architecture Team to implement systems enhancements requested by the ATI plants. The Manufacturing Systems Analyst will also coordinate with ATI service providers for Server/Storage, Network, Database and Deskside when their services are needed to implement systems enhancements or to resolve information technology issues in the ATI plants.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS*: Perform health checks on the manufacturing systems including but not limited to: Bill Of Material DownloadMES ANDONMES Production Monitoring & Control (PM&C)Autosave Upload, Download & CompareTime Schedule Control/Proficy Workflow (TSC)Respond to manufacturing systems outages, including participating in a 24x7 on-call rotationDevelop and implement client requested enhancements to the MES applications and the Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) ToolsetDevelop and implement performance improvement to the MES applications, TSC and TPMKeep abreast of new technology for manufacturing systems *Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  EDUCATION REQUIREMENT:  Minimum of 2-year Associates degree in a technical field. Additional consideration given for 4-year BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer & Information Technology, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or similar technical field.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:  REQUIRED: 10 + years of relevant experience in the IT industry5 + years of experience supporting information systems and infrastructure in a manufacturing organization5 + years of experience developing and supporting SCADA solutions built with GE Digital Cimplicity software5 + years of experience developing or supporting applications built in the Microsoft .Net framework running on Windows Server5 + years of experience developing or supporting applications built on SQL Server, including experience writing and supporting SQL stored proceduresAbility to self-learn new technologies with little directionExcellent oral and written communication skillsAdvanced analytical and problem solving skillsAbility to effectively manage multiple tasks and priorities PREFERRED: Experience developing and supporting web based applicationsExperience with developing and supporting solutions utilizing barcodesExperience utilizing GE Digital Plant Applications and WorkflowExperience utilizing OPC for data collectionExperience with Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) Ladder Logic.Relevant technical certificationsWorking knowledge of ITIL IT Service Management concepts and principlesExperience with ServiceNow ITSM platform Allison Transmission is an equal opportunity employer. We have opportunities for all qualified applicants regardless of age, race, color, sex, religion, creed, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression or veteran status.  If you are an individual with a disability or a disabled veteran requiring assistance and/or reasonable accommodations reviewing any of the careers information, please contact us at 317-242-5000. Primary Location:Indianapolis, INAdditional Locations:

Name: Business Systems Analyst Intern, IT
Description: Job TitleBusiness Systems Analyst Intern, ITLocationCarmel, INJob Details At CNO Financial, we believe interns bring new perspectives to existing challenges. The CNO Financial Intern Program gives students an opportunity to learn about CNO and network while doing important work for the organization. This program compliments the learning that each department provides for the students through work and other activities. Internships Include: • Leader Talks  • Career Counseling  • Development Opportunities  • Department Tour  • Volunteering Event  • Networking  • Final Presentations  As a Business Analyst intern, you are responsible for requirements elicitation, analysis and creating requirements documentation which can include visualization and modeling. Name: Sr Budget Analyst
Description: Raytheon Intelligence, Information and Services (IIS) is looking for a finance professional to join the Budgets & Rates team in support of the II&S Rates organization.  This position reports to the RTS Segment Lead, and may be located in Richardson, TX; Burlington, MA; Dulles, VA or Indianapolis, IN.  As a Senior Budget Analyst, you will work with various functions and levels within the business. Primary responsibilities will include: analyzing variances within indirect rate pools, direct and support labor rate analysis; supporting Forward Pricing Rate updates, including timely responses to DCAA audit questions; assisting with Raytheon Corporate Reporting requirements; and providing ad hoc reporting and analysis. Required Experience, Knowledge, and/or Skills:Requires a related university degree or equivalent experience and a minimum of 4 years of prior relevant experience.Ability to manage simultaneously multiple detailed tasks and meet deadlinesAdvanced Excel skillsAbility to use analytics to understand trends and forecast future results as well as to understand the root cause of variancesStrong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to interface with all levels of management effectivelyAbility to present complex data conciselyAbility to quickly learn and utilize new business systems and reporting tools (e.g., SAP, BW, Control)Ability to work effectively as part of a team as well as independentlyDesired Experience, Knowledge, and/or Skills:Understanding of indirect rates and how they are appliedFinance experience in the aerospace/defense industry; familiarity with Cost Accounting Standards (CAS) and the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR)Experience in BPS / RPlan, SAP and Control 9,Familiarity with II&S pool structures (fringe, overhead, G&A, etc.)Experience in SAP data extractionRequired Education (including Major):Requires a related university degree or equivalent experience and a minimum of 4 years of prior relevant experience. 125891Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Name: Senior Inventory Planning Analyst
Description: Job Category:Supply ChainAt Republic Airline, our mission is to provide a safe, clean and reliable flying experience. We believe this is best accomplished by focusing on our vision, “With the BEST people, products and performance, we will be America’s Regional Airline of choice.” Republic Airline, based in Indianapolis, operates a fleet of 188 Embraer 170/175 aircraft and offers scheduled passenger service with 900 daily flights to 100 cities in 35 U.S. states, Canada, the Caribbean and Central America. The airline provides fixed-fee flights operated under our major airline partner brands of American Eagle, Delta Connection and United Express. Our 10 domiciles include CMH, DCA, EWR, IND, LGA, MCI, MIA, ORD, PHL and PIT. With more than 5,500 talented aviation professionals, Republic Airline is a great place to get your career off the runway!POSITION PURPOSEAnalyzes supply chain operations in order to optimize spare parts inventory. Establishes and manages the variable elements of planning such as part stratification, forecasting, demand history, production schedules, planning lead-times, MIN MAX replenishment, intercompany shipping channels, lifecycle management, and target service levels. ESSENTIAL DUTIES To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Proactively monitors and analyzes inventory and demand trends, reliability, turn-around-time, system departure activity inventory deviations, and other variable inputs using historical and predictive statistical models to accurately forecast future inventory requirements and maintain and optimize minimum/maximum levels and station allocations. Reviews and adjusts min/max levels on regular intervals that support maintenance operations at the least total cost. Influences and collaborates with key stakeholders including Maintenance Planning, Maintenance, Engineering, MRO, Purchasing, and Finance on Planning variables and dynamic outputs.Prepares analysis and leads cross-functional projects to design, plan, and implement planning initiatives.Develops, maintains, investigates and utilizes mathematical and logical models used to optimize spare parts for airline maintenance.Studies airline business processes and recommends system rules; identifies opportunities to implement system automation and exception based management for the Material Planning department.Models inventory requirements that support planned and unplanned maintenance activities for expendable, consumable, shop supply, repairable and/or rotable part categories.Assists in forecasting inventory requirements and improves forecast accuracy based on input from Engineering, Finance and Maintenance Planning; coordinates with Purchasing, Materials Services, Warranty/Repair and other stakeholders to ensure inventory is available for scheduled events, and on disbursement of seed units and availability of service bulletin kits. Provides output of 3/6/12/24 month demand forecast.Interprets demand and supply drivers and makes optimized decisions to impact the operation and financial goals.Maps and documents new and existing processes with a focus on efficiency, accuracy and service and support improvements.Performs initial and on-going provisioning for prospective and active fleets. Gathers and analyses all pertinent and relevant data and reviews and develops provisioning recommendations to ensure adequate physical spares inventory to meet operational requirements with consideration for budgetary limitations.Analyzes and reviews Non AOG and Non Heavy Check material requisitions for action.Takes a proactive approach to insuring that Part Master entries are accurate in all respects. Maintains correct Part Master identification of Rotable, Consumable and Expendable processes and categories. Researches and implements additions and changes in the Part Master due to evolving Maintenance requirements, Engineering Orders and Manufacturing changes. Ensures approved alternate part numbers are correctly identified in the Part Master. Maintains special Part Master attributes such as Hazmat identification, shelf-life requirements, calibration intervals and preventive maintenance requirements.Performs other duties as assigned.REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIESThe requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability necessary to perform this job.EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE.Bachelor's degree (B.A./B.S.) or equivalent in Aviation Management, Business, Purchasing, Materials Management or related field. Requires 2 years of experience in purchasing, supply chain management or related area. Excellent computer skills including MS Office. PREFERRED EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE5 years of experience. Prefer Production and Inventory Management certification or Professional in Supply Management Certification. LANGUAGE SKILLSAble to read, analyze, and interpret common technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents. Able to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community. Able to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directors.REASONING/PROBLEM SOLVING ABILITYAble to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and apply principles of logical thinking and mathematical formulas to draw valid conclusions. Able to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.DECISION MAKING Makes decisions to support strategic decisions. Decisions tend to be medium range and of medium significance with moderate consequences.PHYSICAL DEMANDSThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.Able to move about the work environment. Frequently required to stand, walk, sit, talk and hear.WORK ENVIRONMENTThe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an associate encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.Typically not exposed to extreme environmental conditions.TRAVEL REQUIREMENTSAble to travel up to 10% of the time, including overnight travel.Republic Airline is committed to providing qualified applicants and associates reasonable accommodation, when necessary, to enable the individuals to complete the application process and/or perform the essential functions of the job. An applicant and/or associate requiring reasonable accommodation to perform any essential job function, should contact Human Resources.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP here.Selected candidate(s) for hire must complete the following prior to employment: a criminal history report, global screen, drug screen, employment credit report and if applicable, a driving record.Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with DisabilitiesThe contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.

Name: Sales Compensation Analyst/Senior Analyst
Description: Job CategoryFinance and Operations  Job Details  Job Title: Sales Compensation Analyst/Senior Analyst Locations: Onsite in Indianapolis, IN  About Salesforce:Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named #1 on Fortune?s 2017 list of World?s Best Workplaces, one of Forbes's "World's Most Innovative Company" five years in a row and one of Fortune's "100 Best Companies to Work For" eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world. Description: The Sales Compensation Analyst/Senior Analyst is a key position in the Global Sales Compensation team and is responsible for incentive commission processing, reporting and case management functions. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated and detail-oriented, with demonstrated problem solving and decision making skills. This role will be fully engaged in the support of our sales teams and is an outstanding opportunity to collaborate extensively with the global Sales and Services organizations and partner cross-functionally with our Crediting Operations, Design and Effectiveness, Strategy & Enablement, Human Resources, Order Management, Finance and Payroll teams. The Global Sales Compensation team is the global leader for sales commission polices and processes for our direct and indirect sales teams, including North America, EMEA, APAC and Japan. Responsibilities: + Manage the monthly commission process for our sales teams and other commissionable employees. This includes understanding and applying the commission plan consistently, ensuring commissions calculations comply with the plan and managing exception requests versus policy. Provide expertise, support and training to the international teams on these plans.  + Resolve case inquiries and be a trusted advisor to our sales team. Frequent communication with account executives and sales management via commission cases. Process corrections and adjustments as they arise.  + Provide recommendations to sales leadership and the internal comp management team regarding exceptions requests and case escalations.  + Be the trusted partner for all upstream and downstream business functions. Provide backup support within the team for the following areas: comp metrics and reporting, accounting schedules, SOX support, Commission checklists and commission administration.  + Document business processes and create desktop procedures for monthly/quarterly close, commission accounting tasks, and audits.  + Execute assigned projects as needed and recommend and deliver process improvements. Education & Experience: + 3+ years of experience is required, ideally in sales compensation, finance, accounting or other related field. A Bachelor Degree required; Finance, Economics, or related field is preferred.  + Strong communication (written and verbal), organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills, along with strong attention to detail.  + Experience in automated sales commissions systems and their set-up and operation is a plus (e.g. Xactly, Callidus, Oracle EIM, etc.).  + Advanced skills in MS Excel. Desired Skills: + Experience in administering sales commissions.  + Ability to multi-task while managing deadlines, to perform well under pressure and to work independently and as a part of a team.  + Demonstrated success in a collaborative, start-up-paced environment.  + Good business acumen and awareness of business trends.  + Strong communication (written and verbal), organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills, along with strong attention to detail.  + High degree of motivation, flexibility and creativity.  Posting Statement  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!

Name: Telecom / IT Contract Analyst
Description: SUMMARY:  AOTMP, a fast-growing entrepreneurial company based in Indianapolis, with telecom management clients across the globe, is seeking a Telecom Contract Analyst. The Telecom Contract Analyst will review Telecom and IT contracts for clients to assure that terms, conditions and pricing points are being met. This position will be responsible for handling specific client ongoing projects. You will work closely with your team members to ensure that all project requirements, deadlines and schedules are on track. Responsibilities include review of all assigned clients Telecom and IT contracts, preparing status reports, and establishing effective communication plans for the Program Management team. The Telecom Contract Analyst enhances the department and our company reputation by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.RESPONSIBILITIES:The ideal candidate develops and administers processes, procedures, and guidelines to align the contract review process to the strategic goals of the client organization. Review of all client contracts and the assembly of this information into an outputted summary document/report.Analysis of contracts and benchmarking terms, conditions, and service level agreements.Responsible for ensuring that pricing is competitive and billing accurately.Create and maintain comprehensive project documentationProvide ownership of all active assigned projects.Preparing status reports by gathering, analyzing and summarizing relevant information.Communicate with cross discipline team members to make sure that all parties are on track with project requirements, deadlines, and schedules.Structure internal project meetings to review project status, identify any speed bumps for the project, and resolve all identified issues.Submitting project deliverables and ensuring that they adhere to quality standards.Establishing effective project communication plans and ensuring their execution.Perform risk management to minimize project risks.Review client needs for due diligence, risk assessment, and constant vendor monitoring are being accomplished.Coordinating the development of user manuals, training materials and other documents as needed to enable successful implementation and turnover of the contract catalogs to the clients.Identifying and developing new opportunities with clients. · Client facing experience in telecommunications, consulting, business analysis.  · Self-motivated, innovative person with analytical, problem solving, organizational and interpersonal skills.  · Ability to work with limited direction and ability to understand and complete delegated tasks with superior customer focused quality. REQUIREMENTS:Bachelors degree or masters degree in a related field.Minimum three years of experience in a procurement or supply chain role with contract and price negotiation experienceStrong commercial awareness of the Network & Telecom marketKnowledge of contracting terms and standardsKeen attention to detail with strong analytical, and problem-solving skillsStrong data and financial analytical skills; Proficient in analyzing and manipulating data in Excel and or within a Database.Ability to lead and manage multiple project and activities simultaneously.Knowledge of eSourcing platforms.High ethical standards, Self-motivated and goal oriented.Comfortable working in environments across several time zones.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Strong working knowledge of Office365.Strong understanding of formal project management methodologies. · Advanced MS Office Suite and advanced MS Excel experience that includes filtering, VLOOKUP; grouping and pivot tables  · Experience monitoring and working with multiple types of service providers (carriers).  · Experience working with very large, Fortune 500 global companies preferred. TELECOM CONTRACT ANALYST TOP SKILLS & PROFICIENCY:Analysis of financial data pointsStrong Excel, PowerPoint and Word skillsVendor contract negotiations experienceProject ManagementProcess ImprovementVendor sourcing and procurementPlanningPerformance ManagementVerbal & Written CommunicationStrategic thinker

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThis opportunity includes: · Room for growth, with low turnover  · Being a part of future growth with the company that has long-term reward  Job Requirements  · Create financial models to provide forecasting, reporting, and tracking of financial metrics that support and drive company strategy  · Have a consultant mindset to develop solutions to control costs and support critical business development  · Develop KPIs, design reports regarding financial metrics and risk assessments  · Assist in implementing new procedures in support of reporting needs  · Planning, forecasting, modeling, and P&L reporting of financial results  · Lead weekly financial reporting estimation and reporting  · Evaluate production efficiencies and yields and draw conclusions using operational data  · Support cross-functional activities, such as pricing support for sales and marketing teams and communicate variances monthly Financial Analyst qualifications: · Bachelors Degree in Finance  · 2+ years of financial analyst experience  · Accounting familiarity  · Presentation, reporting, monthly closing process, accounts payable and communication skills  · Positive, adaptable, self-starter who can meet deadlines  · Excel, Access, data query and data management  Company DescriptionCFS is a leading, employee-owned accounting and financial staffing firmthe largest one founded by CPA firms. With more than two decades of experience helping companies locate, attract and hire exceptional accounting & finance professionals, CFS has unique resources to better understand hiring needs, attract higher-caliber candidates and assess candidate potential. Established in 1994, CFS today operates 30+ offices across 21 states and the Caribbean. Serving most major U.S. markets and beyond, CFS connects companies with candidates, from entry-level to executive level, temporary to direct hire and project support to interim management.  CFS has twice been named to Forbes list of Best Professional Recruiting Firms and twice cited by LinkedIn as one of the Most Socially Engaged Staffing Agencies.

Name: ERP Analyst II
Description: Job Category: Maintenance  At Republic Airline, our mission is to provide a safe, clean and reliable flying experience. We believe this is best accomplished by focusing on our vision, With the BEST people, products and performance, we will be Americas Regional Airline of choice. Republic Airline, based in Indianapolis, operates a fleet of 188 Embraer 170/175 aircraft and offers scheduled passenger service with 900 daily flights to 100 cities in 35 U.S. states, Canada, the Caribbean and Central America. The airline provides fixed-fee flights operated under our major airline partner brands of American Eagle, Delta Connection and United Express. Our 10 domiciles include CMH, DCA, EWR, IND, LGA, MCI, MIA, ORD, PHL and PIT. With more than 5,500 talented aviation professionals, Republic Airline is a great place to get your career off the runway! POSITION PURPOSE Evaluates and analyzes the Enterprise Resources Planning (ERP) system and serves as a subject matter expert representative. ESSENTIAL DUTIESTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Ensures the effective use of the ERP and other critical Company systems.Coordinates implementing requirements of the ERP system with department managers and directors.Audits, updates and maintains user guides on how to use the ERP system.Provides support and training to receiving inspectors, QA Auditors, etc on effective use of the ERP and on other related company systems.Tests defects and enhancements to the system. Writes up and creates test environments.Registers defects and new requirement requests with the ERP system supplier and monitors progress.Performs acceptance testing and develops test cases for defects and enhancements to the system.Serves as the subject matter expert for the ERP with such areas as maintenance programs, mechanics, records, supply chain, purchasing, finance and engineering.Analyzes requests from the business for new functionality and submits proposals for review.Compiles requirements information from outside vendors.Evaluates new systems for purchase in regards to program interface with current systems.Provides recurrent training to the field on the use of automation and technology.Coordinates new requirements across functional areas.Responds to issues forwarded by Republic IT ticket system; provides after hours support as needed.Performs other duties as assigned or required.REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIESThe requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability necessary to perform this job. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE. High school diploma or GED.A&P License and RII required.At least four years of airline experience with at least one of those years in aircraft maintenance inspection or related experience. PREFERRED EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE Bachelors degree or equivalent in aviation, IT systems area or equivalent.Related systems experience (RAMCO, SAP or similar system).Additional years of experience in Aviation, Supply Chain or IT systems. LANGUAGE SKILLS  Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions,  technical and procedure manuals Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and  procedure manuals. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or associates of the  organization.  REASONING/PROBLEM SOLVING ABILITY  Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only  limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral,  diagram, or schedule form.  DECISION MAKING  Makes limited decisions and determines best methods to solve problems by referring to established precedents and policies. Impact of decisions is moderately low. PHYSICAL DEMANDSThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Able to move about the work environment.  Frequently required to stand, walk, sit, talk and hear. WORK ENVIRONMENTThe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an associate encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Typical conditions of an indoor office environment. Occasionally work in an open air hangar. TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS Able to travel up to 20% of the time, including overnight travel.  Republic Airline is committed to providing qualified applicants and associates reasonable accommodation, when necessary, to enable the individuals to complete the application process and/or perform the essential functions of the job. An applicant and/or associate requiring reasonable accommodation to perform any essential job function, should contact Human Resources. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP here at https://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeocselfprint_poster.pdf%E2%80%8B .Selected candidate(s) for hire must complete the following prior to employment: a criminal history report, global screen, drug screen, employment credit report and if applicable, a driving record. Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities  The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractors legal duty to furnish information.  Republic Airline, based in Indianapolis, operates a fleet of approximately 190 Embraer 170/175 aircraft and offers scheduled passenger service with 950 daily flights to 100 cities in 35 U.S. states, Canada, the Caribbean and Central America. The airline provides fixed-fee flights operated under our major airline partner brands of American Eagle, Delta Connection and United Express. The airline employs about 5,500 aviation professionals. Visit www.rjet.com at http://http//www.rjet.com/ for more information, follow the company on Instagram, Twitter and YouTube, and connect on Facebook or LinkedIn.

Name: Data Warehousing Analyst
Description: This position is typically filled at a salary of $59,202  Work for Indiana  U.S News & World Report's #1 state government! With more than 50 executive branch agencies, the State of Indiana is a diverse workforce offering applicants stimulating and challenging projects across a broad scope of career opportunities. As a State of Indiana employee, you impact the well-being of Indiana's communities every day.  About Indiana Department of Transportation  The Indiana Department of Transportation (INDOT) provides a dynamic workplace that serves Indiana citizens, improves our state's quality of life, and enhances its economic opportunity. INDOT has a number of innovative programs and projects, including Public-Private Partnerships, Green Initiatives, and cutting-edge uses of materials and assets. As part of the State of Indiana, INDOT offers a competitive total compensation package, as well as outstanding work/life balance. Whether you are an established professional in the transportation field or just starting your career, INDOT has exciting and challenging opportunities for you.  About the Job  Employee works in the Data Management section of the Management Information Systems (MIS) Division in Indiana Department of Transportation (INDOT) at a senior level, and reports to the manager of the section. Employee utilizes data warehouse building/maintenance tools to collect data from various INDOT systems and external sources, loads it in the data warehouse and builds queries/reports on this data.  A Day in the Life Develop, maintain, and support the enterprise data warehouse and corresponding data marts;Research source data, understand reporting needs and prepare the data warehouse to store data and deliver it to the queries/reports/dashboards in the most efficient manner.Build, run and maintain the Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) routines;Review data loaded into the data warehouse for accuracy;Build and maintain queries/reports/dashboards to display the data from the warehouse;Establish written procedures, guidelines and development standards for data warehouse operation;Confer with section management for planning, organizing and controlling the activities of assigned area;Provide input to MIS management on the status of ongoing projects and existing applications;Perform other duties as assigned. What We're Looking For Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field required.Advanced knowledge of data warehouse design and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) design tools, preferably Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) required.Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools such as Oracle SQL Developer and TOAD required;Advanced knowledge of enterprise database design, Structured Query Language (SQL) - data definition language (DDL) and data manipulation language (DML), and data dictionaries required;Advanced knowledge of query/report design tools such as Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE) and Oracle Data Visualization Desktop (ODVD) required;Advanced knowledge of computer hardware/software capabilities and configurations required;Advanced knowledge of data communication, systems connectivity and Windows operating system required;Ability to perform logic analysis required;Ability to read and understand complex technical manuals required;Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing required Benefits of Working for INDOT  The Indiana Department of Transportation offers a comprehensive benefit package which includes: Four (4) medical plan options (including RX coverage) and vision/dental coveragesWellness program (offers eligibility into a discounted medical plan)Health savings account (includes bi-weekly state contribution)Deferred compensation account (similar to 401k plan) with employer matchTwo (2) fully-funded pension plan optionsGroup life insuranceEmployee assistance program that allows for covered behavioral health visitsPaid vacation, personal and sick time offCompetitive leave policies covering a variety of employee needs12 company paid holidays, 14 on election yearsQualified employer for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness ProgramNew Parent LeaveEqual Employment Opportunity: The State of Indiana is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job Description: Role: Data Analyst-Professional  Location: 10405 Crosspoint Blvd, Indianapolis, IN 46256  Duration : 6+ months  Description  Minimum Requirements: 1. BS/BA in Mathematics, Information Management, Statistics, Supply Chain, or equivalent. 2. 3 years minimum experience in data analysis Required Skills: 1. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 2. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 3. Expert user of Microsoft Excel 4. Proficient in other Microsoft applications: PowerPoint, Word, Visio, and Access. 5. Basic statistics knowledge is required. With direction from the project team, perform the following work: 1. Attend weekly project meetings to: a. Get instructions from the project team and your supervisor. b. Report status of assignments. 2. Receive data from project managers and review it for accuracy and completeness. When necessary, follow-up with the data source contacts on any modification, correction, or clarifications. 3. Analyze data, interpret trends, and summarize per defined instructions and/or procedures. Examples include: Cost benefit analysis, Calculate operational and cost metrics. Compare actuals against market needs. Maintain project spreadsheets and databases. Prepare statistical reports and graphs . Furnishes custom reports and presentations.  This position has a lot of data mining, reporting, and analysis tied to key projects, KPI's, and metrics. High proficiency with MS Access and excel is required. Being able to multi-task is key. Good communications skills is key.

Name: Reconciliation Analyst- Financial Services
Description: Reconciliation Analyst I Location:Indianapolis, IN Company Overview: Cortland Capital Market Services LLC (“Cortland”) is a member of the Alter Domus Group. Cortland offers issuers and investors in credit and real estate assets a comprehensive suite of asset and portfolio solutions including fund administration, agency services, securitization services, and CLO Collateral Administration. For more information on Alter Domus, please visit: www.alterdomus.com or on Cortland: www.cortlandglobal.comPosition Description: The Reconciliation analyst implements and maintains client-level data reconciliation requirements that identify matching rules with source systems, banks/trustees, and our reconcilement system. The Reconciliation Analyst I will assist the agency team to deliver quality, on-time reconciliation reports for distribution to key business stakeholders, and process outages as instructed by the business unit. The Reconciliation Analyst I position allows an individual to contribute to the success of the agency team while learning the concepts, functions, and systems involved in providing reconciliation services. Name: Global Partnership Analyst
Description: Wolters Kluwer is a global leader in professional information services. Professionals in the areas of legal, business, tax, accounting, finance, audit, risk, compliance and healthcare rely on Wolters Kluwer's market leading information-enabled tools and software solutions to manage their business efficiently, deliver results to their clients, and succeed in an ever more dynamic world. Every day, our customers make critical decisions to help save lives, improve the way we do business, build better judicial and regulatory systems. We help them get it right.  Within Wolters Kluwer, CT Corporation contains our expert information services businesses that serve large corporations, small businesses and law firms specializing in incorporation and legal business compliance solutions and clearance and protection solutions for trademark and brand professionals. Responsibilities:Provide support and drive results in areas surrounding global partnerships and alliances, operations support, financial and data analysis support and other key roles as determinedLead and participate in projects related to the identification of potential partners, partnership operational assessments, pricing negotiations, profitability analysis, coverage model analysis, service level management and strategic partnership pipeline analysisCoordinate, influence and participate in projects and the on-boarding of new partnersWork with leadership to achieve goals including Best Customer Experience, Best in Class Economics, and Great Place to WorkManage reporting responsibilities, analyze data and reports, as well as identify and implement opportunities for improvementDevelop and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the CT product line and systems, specifically as they relate to Global Corporate ServicesIdentify gaps in global coverage, potential partners and document process of exploring new partnershipsProvide support to leadership team including analyzing and reporting on metrics; coordinating new partner on-boarding efforts between CT team and strategic partner; coordinating training and development; and representing Wolters Kluwer within the industryQualifications:A minimum of five years of sales/service, operations, vendor/partnership management and/or data analysis experienceBachelor's degree from an accredited college/university or equivalent work experience; Project Management Professional (PMP), and/or Six Sigma Green or Black Belt preferredExperience gathering and analyzing information, integrating information from multiple sources quickly and accurately, as well as utilizing the results from analysis to inform and influence business decisionsDemonstrated ability to prioritize and manage multiple concurrent projects, along with driving and managing projects to successful completionProficient with Microsoft Office Suite applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and OutlookExperience using Sales tools such as Salesforce.com; and ancillary software to support the CRM databaseStrong working knowledge of E1, Salesforce.com, Tableau, and/or Arrow preferredAbility to travel up to 40% Wolters Kluwer N.V. (AEX: WKL) is a global leader in information services and solutions for professionals in the health, tax and accounting, risk and compliance, finance and legal sectors. We help our customers make critical decisions every day by providing expert solutions that combine deep domain knowledge with specialized technology and services.  Wolters Kluwer reported 2017 annual revenues of ?4.4billion. The company, headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands, serves customers in over 180 countries, maintains operations in over 40 countries and employs 19,000 people worldwide. Wolters Kluwer shares are listed on Euronext Amsterdam (WKL) and are included in the AEX and Euronext 100 indices.  For more information about our solutions and organization, visit www.wolterskluwer.com, follow us on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY Wolters Kluwer U. S. Corporation and all of its subsidiaries, divisions and customer/business units is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Name: Jr. Cost Analyst
Description: Position: Jr. Acquisition Specialist Location: Indianapolis, IN Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (“JPS”) is currently seeking qualified and motivated candidate. Job Description:Must be able to collect amd analyze data and organize it in a standard work breakdown structure. Must be knowledge of cost methodologies and cost modeling applications, including Microsoft Excel. Must also be knowledgeable of time value of money, net present value, real US nominal dollars and other common cost estimating practices.Acquisition planning assistance, including market research and recommending procurement strategy.Acquisition document development, including cost/price estimates, quality assurance surveillance plans, statements of objectives, synopsis, solicitations, price memoranda, source selection plans, etc.Expect assistance in supporting quote and quote evaluations, including price/cost analysis or technical quote or quote analysis.Contract administration support services, including assistance with reviewing contractor performance, developing contract modifications, and investigating reports of contract discrepancies.Contract/task order closeout assistanceDrafting policy or procedure documents for government review.B.A or B.S Degree (in a business related field) with a combination of education and five (5) years of procurement/ acquisition experience and at least 3 of those years shall have been at a junior level.Extensive working knowledge of Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) will be required.U.S. Citizenship: Must be able to successfully pass a background check. JPS Corporate Overview: Jamison Professional Services, Inc. (“JPS”) a CVE Certified Service-Disabled Veteran Owned small business, is a customer driven firm with an extensive record of providing superior professional support services to our clients, supporting single and multiple nationally and internationally requirements. JPS consistently and successfully delivers qualified employees to numerous Federal agencies as well as other public and private sectors across a broad field of occupations and disciplines.  JPS offers a wide range of employment opportunities in the commercial and government arenas. We seek employees who share our values of service excellence, integrity and professionalism.  JPS affords equal employment opportunity to all individuals, regardless of race, creed, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity, or sexual orientation. JPS’s commitment to equal opportunity is applied through every aspect of the employment relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, selection, placement, training, compensation, promotion, transfer, termination, and all other matters of employment.  Applicants may be required to successfully complete an online test to determine qualification for positions requiring specific skills. Please DO NOT contact with JPS regarding this opportunity. All applications must be submitted through our applications system at: http://careers.jps-online.net/x/openings

Name: Compensation Analyst - Physician Workforce
Description: PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESConducting research to understand industry and organization-specific issues, including financial information, compensation and rewards and corporate performance.Researching, gathering and analyzing data to determine the appropriate salary level and job title for existing and proposed positions.Conducting market pricing, assisting in peer group selection, survey analyses, interpreting salary data, financial modeling and special research projects.Assisting with report and proposal writing as it relates to describing and summarizing project objectives, methodologies, analysis and results as well as proofing for accuracy.Work with consultants on projects including program design, analysis, budgeting and implementation.Responding to client-related requests, as appropriate.EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTSBachelor’s degree in a business-related field, ideally with an emphasis in finance, economics, statistics, or mathematics.One to two years of business-related experience is preferred, preferably involving data analysis and financial modeling.Experience working within a consulting, compensation or health care-related firm is preferred.Solid technical knowledge and experience working with Excel, Word and PowerPoint. Name: Commercial Banking - Client Service Analyst - Middle Market Banking & Specialized Industries
Description: *MMBSI** Middle Market Banking & Specialized Industries (MMBSI) is a Commercial Banking  business located in more than 100 offices across the US and  Canada. MMBSI provides credit, cash management, capital markets and  corporate finance advisory solutions to corporations, municipalities and  not-for-profit entities via our Core Banking or Specialized Industries  teams.  Core  Banking teams generally focus on clients with annual revenues of $20 million to  $500 million. Our local delivery model, coupled with the firm?s global  resources, allows us to provide clients with customized, comprehensive  solutions and exceptional service.  Within our Specialized Industries practice, we have experts strategically  focused on serving businesses within a variety of industry segments, including,  but not limited to: Agribusiness, Government, Healthcare and  Technology. By employing our industry expertise we can deliver  comprehensive financial solutions that are tailored to industry dynamics and  standards.  In MMBSI, our competitive advantages include robust international capabilities,  the ability to provide clients with access to world-class investment banking  solutions and our focus on industry specialization. This key differentiator,  combined with our dedication to personalized service, allows us to build  long-term relationships with mid-sized businesses and a wide spectrum of  municipalities and not-for-profit entities. *Client Service** As a Client Service Analyst  for **MMBSI** , you will report to a Client Service Sr. Associate or  Client Service Manager. You will be responsible for various relationship  management activities and operational controls for an assigned portfolio of  clients. In this role, you will serve as the primary point of service  contact for each client within your assigned portfolio. The assigned  client portfolio may be comprised of operating transactional accounts and  complex treasury products. Core functional responsibilities and  expectations include but are not limited to the following:  + Understand client issues, be responsible for providingtimely follow-up to clients and be accountable for client satisfactionthrough the ownership of the problem  + Resolve issues by identifying underlying or hiddenproblems and patterns  + Build knowledge of commercial treasury managementproducts and services.  + Serve as a liaison between Relationship team,Operations, Treasury Management Sales and Implementations to provide thebest service to the client, your department and the firm  + Identify and control risk to prevent fraudulent accountbehavior and potential fraud exposure  + Prioritize daily workload to maximize productivityutilizing time management and organizational skills  + Follow all established policies, procedures andpractices  + Project a confident and professional presence to ourclients, other bank departments and the community  + Team building skills and interpersonal relationshipskills  + Desire to exceed client expectations  + Expected to work independently with supervision andescalate complex issues as necessary to resolve customer requests in atimely manner  Daily activities will include but are not limited to the following: + Maintaining treasury products and accounts  + Research and resolution of customer?s treasuryinquiries  + Preparing and collecting account documentation  + Managing internal project initiatives for yourportfolio of clients  + Participate in joint client calls with Bankers andTreasury Sales Officers both in person and over the phone  + Over time you will be expected to be able to identifyproducts and services that may benefit clients and improve overallrelationship profitability *_The final officer title and jobgrade is at the discretion of the firm and will be discussed at the time ofoffer. It may be different than what is listed on the requisition basedon candidate experience level._** JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

After the training period is over, they will either be assigned to the 7am-3:30pm shift or the 7:30am-4:00pm shift or 9:00-5:30. There will be some weekend and holiday work required on a limited basis. This person may also be required to work the late shift 11:30am – 8:00pm on a rotating basis. Technicians will be required to provide phone and queue support and perform primary trouble-shooting for all in-coming calls and tickets relating to; active directory and voice mail passwords, as well as network and telecommunications issues. As such, Knowledge Services is committed to providing opportunities for growth – in our company, in each team member and in our relationships. We believe titles do not define a person, but provide a framework to each person’s endless potential. Our focus on improving our team, product and processes drive us every day. We are guided by our four Pillars that set the foundation of who we are and how we conduct business: Knowledge, Integrity, Innovation, and Service. Name: Business Consultant
