The ideal candidate should have in-depth contact center knowledge, including but not limited to proficiency of contact center operations, workforce management, quality monitoring, training and contact center technology.  The applicant should be creative and have strong interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Ideal candidate would have process improvement, project management, and strategy experience, have superior oral and written communication skills, a client service focus, as well as the ability to identify opportunities for improvement, develop recommendations and implement complex solutions in a fast paced environment. *Principal Duties and Essential Responsibilities:** ?Providing organizational expertise and support to clients on a day to day basis  ?Providing project management expertise and guidance to clients on an ongoing basis  ?Conducting assessments of organizational structure and effectiveness  ?Identifying project risks, developing recommendations and implementing effective and proactive risk mitigation solutions  ?Facilitating complex and large group conversations and meetings with a focus on collaboration and actionable results  ?Designing, leading, and facilitating process improvement initiatives  ?Developing and facilitating implementation of organizational strategy and design  ?Championing organizational change and participating in the implementation of new ideas  ?Identifying and implementing best practices for process re-design, improvement, and implementation  ?Using research to uncover insights leading to proposed solutions, refined through further research and analysis, targeted to support rapid iteration  ?Identifying new opportunities to add value both within and beyond the scope of formal projects  ?Organizing, leading and facilitating enterprise wide process improvement initiatives that encompass an end-to-end analysis and future state redesign  ?Developing root cause analysis and business case for proposed technology, staff and structure changes, including cost estimates  ?Identifying key customer metrics and KPIs based on raw data and interview insights  ?Developing delivery solutions based upon the analysis output and/or conversations with prospective clients and creating proposals, statements of work, project plans, project team, deliverables, savings opportunity accordingly  ?Leading and participating in consulting engagements  ?Leading and/or participating in change initiatives, improve client business operations and deliver significant improvements to process, management discipline, bottom line, etc. *Minimum Requirements:** ? Bachelor's Degree  5 plus years of relevant work experience  ?Previous management consulting experience required  ?Contact Center and Back Office Experience required  ?Successful completion of Verint background screening process including, but not limited to, employment verifications, criminal search, OFAC, and SS verification *Preferred Skills, Knowledge and Experience:** ?Knowledge of Verint tools and how they are used to address business challenges is a strong plus  ?Contact center consulting and/or leadership expertise  ?Voice of the customer and journey mapping expertise  ?Process reengineering and optimization expertise  ?Performance management expertise  ?Advanced analytical problem solving skills  ?Strong conceptual thinking ability  ?Attention to detail and perseverance to completion  ?Strong organization/time management skills  ?Strong relationship building between internal customers, vendors and employees  As an equal opportunity employer, Verint Systems Inc. prides itself in providing employees with a work environment in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity. This means we are committed to providing equal opportunity to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to one?s race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, disability, alienage or citizenship status, marital status, creed, genetic predisposition or carrier status, sexual orientation, Veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment including but not limited to hiring, placement, promotion, compensation, training, leave of absence or termination.

Name: Operations Analyst
Description: Wolters Kluwer Health's Clinical Effectiveness (CE) organization is a fast-growing and innovation-driven healthcare information technology (HIT) provider working on the front lines of clinical care. Our talented team of physician and pharmacist editors, technologists, and product visionaries collaborate to provide advanced clinical decision support solutions that measurably improve clinical effectiveness by helping healthcare professionals provide optimal care for their patients.  Our talented team of physician editors, pharmacists, technologists, and product visionaries collaborate to provide solutions that measurably improve clinical effectiveness by helping healthcare professionals provide optimal care for their patients. POSITION SUMMARY The Operations Analyst supports the CE Program Management Office in its mission to define a consistent methodology for planning and managing programs, both technical (e.g. product development) and business (e.g. marketing launch, acquisition integration, etc.) initiatives across the CE organization. The Operations Analyst will work with business stakeholders to define dashboarding and reporting requirements, to implement dashboards and reports, and to design and execute tools and procedures for gathering operations data, keeping it up to date, and disseminating it to the business.  This position reports to either our Waltham MA, Chicago IL, or Indianapolis IN office locations. ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIESKey Responsibilities:Working with business stakeholders, define requirements for dashboards and reports on CE programs and operations.Develop, maintain, and continuously approve CE programs and operations dashboards and reports.Develop, create, and maintain ad-hoc reports to meeting organizational needs.Develop and execute tools and procedures to keep programs and operations data accurate and up-to-date on a continuous basis.Support and execute staff training, data collection, reporting and other initiatives for the CE Program Management Office. Education: Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Program/Process Management, or related field or equivalent, demonstrable work experience. Interpersonal & Technical Skills:Strong research, analysis, and decision-making skills.Accountable -- must embody a strong sense of responsibility for the timely completion of tasks, as well as the responsibility to ensure a shared understanding of shared tasks.Excellent communication skills. Ability to communicate at all levels of the organization.Communicative and social -- excellent interpersonal skills including the ability to work with diverse stakeholders and personality types. Ability to bridge the gap between technical and business stakeholders.Assertive -- not afraid to be a voice of reason and authority.Enthusiastic -- must be high-energy and situationally aware. Passionate advocate for delivering value.Transparent -- must desire to bring complete transparency to the business and grow business trust.Creativity, initiative, and flexibility -- tempered by pragmatism, patience, and attention to detail. Experience: 3+ years of job experience in operations, operations analysis, business analysis, or a related area.  Travel requirements: 5% as needed  Physical Demands: Normal Office Environment. ABOUT WOLTERS KLUWER Wolters Kluwer N.V. (AEX: WKL) is a global leader in information services and solutions for professionals in the health, tax and accounting, risk and compliance, finance and legal sectors. We help our customers make critical decisions every day by providing expert solutions that combine deep domain knowledge with specialized technology and services.  Wolters Kluwer reported 2017 annual revenues of ?4.4 billion. The company, headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands, serves customers in over 180 countries, maintains operations in over 40 countries and employs 19,000 people worldwide. Wolters Kluwer shares are listed on Euronext Amsterdam (WKL) and are included in the AEX and Euronext 100 indices. Wolters Kluwer has a sponsored Level 1 American Depositary Receipt program. The ADRs are traded on the over-the-counter market in the U.S. (WTKWY). For more information about our solutions and organization, visit www.wolterskluwer.com, follow us on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and YouTube. EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY (EEO) Wolters Kluwer U. S. Corporation and all of its subsidiaries, divisions, customer/business units is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. INFORMATION For any assistance with your application for this job opening, please call the HR Source at (888) 495-4772 or email HRSource@WoltersKluwer.com. TTY is also available at 888 (4985) 4771. This program compliments the learning that each department provides for the students through work and other activities.Internships Include: • Leader Talks• Career Counseling• Development Opportunities • Department Tour• Volunteering Event• Networking• Final PresentationsAs a Data Analyst intern, you will provide the business access to someone who can help define what the data is, how to assemble it in a meaningful way and what simple trends & initial insights you have found. Name: Principal Data Analyst Indianapolis, IN or Telecommute
Description: This position will be responsible for defining, implementing and enabling advanced analytics solutions and capabilities as a key member of our analytics team. Along with data analysis and data engineering, this position will be modeling complex business problems and discovering insights through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. Position will be focused on modernizing the Data and Analytics program by maturing our operating model, governance, data quality, data models, technology selection and coordination with external partners and data architect to generate our data strategy roadmap. Primary Responsibilities: Thought leader with strong analytic, communication, and program management skills to lead development and integration of a portfolio of analytics that will form the intelligent engine of visually displayed insight to help decision makers uncover business opportunities  Lead, develop, evaluate and present new techniques and methodologies to drive business results  Design sampling methodology, prepare data, including data cleaning, univariate analysis, missing value imputation, etc., identify appropriate analytic and statistical methodology, develop predictive models and document process and results  Provide on-going tracking and monitoring of performance of analytic applications and recommend ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information  Communicate and present findings, orally and visually in a way that can be easily understood by business counterparts  Collaborate with analytics and other teams to determine how current processing methods can be optimized, scaled, and improved  Drive thought leadership to embrace modern data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence and data analytics as the driving factor behind all business decisions  Construct data pipelines to satisfy downstream modelling needs  Provide informed feedback for database design and data model decisions  Translate customer needs into high quality system solutions and ensures effective operational outcomes  Design rich data visualizations to communicate complex ideas to customers and company leaders  Extend internal data with third party sources of information  Ensure non-functional requirements are considered as part of solutions (e.g. reliability, availability, security usability)

Name: Billing Data Analyst
Description: This position is with Mommy Jobs Online, so please visit mommyjobsonline.com to apply and get registered on our site directly!  As a Billing Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to provide data analysis to support, compile and report key information for billing operations and our overall revenue cycle objectives. This is a position that affords you the ability to drive processes and improvement initiatives with increasing revenue potential and a reduction of bad debt. By gathering and documenting business requirements and utilizing your sharp analytical skills to fulfill the needs of the business and/or clients, you will have an impact on healing the health care system.  Youll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges. Primary Responsibilities: Gather and document business requirements  Analyze and interpret data to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for the business and clients  Communicate analysis and interpretation to appropriate audience  Produce, publish and distribute scheduled and ad-hoc client and operational reports relating to the development and performance of products, processes and technologies  Supporting the reporting and analytics needs of our multiple billing locations Required Qualifications: 1+ years of experience in the following areas:  Business and / or finance analysis experience  Gathering requirements from the client / business and documenting  Project methodology (requirements, design, development, test and implementation)  Analysis of business process and workflow and providing an evaluation, benchmark and / or process improvement recommendations  Intermediate level of proficiency with Excel and Access Preferred Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Business, Finance, Health Administration, related field or equivalent work experience  Healthcare Billing experience  Knowledge of GE Products of IDX, Centricity and or Character Cell (or other billing systems)  Knowledge of COGNOS  Ability to communicate analysis including trends and opportunities to clients and the business in writing and verbally  Ability to problem solve including multiple priorities and research conflicting and/or inaccurate data  Pay : $47,000.00 per year  To Become A Member: Please visit mommyjobsonline.com and click on Join Now and select the Medical Coding WAH Job Bank Registry to become a lifetime member to get connected with this client. Please email us your resume after you register with your qualifications and work history.  Please reference agent id code MJOLCAROLH on your registration submission.  Please feel free to consult with us if you have further job related questions about our company at 1*405*418*6160.

Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: Medxcel Facilities Management is here to lead the transformation of healthcare facilities management by incorporating a new approach to providing services. Created by healthcare, for healthcare, we have a dedicated focus on our people and customers, as well as providing tools, processes, support resources, data analytics and insource strategies that drive results.  The Pricing Analyst position is responsible for collecting and analyzing data from prospective customers and collaborating with Medxcel leadership in the development of program and pricing strategies to position the company to optimize profitability. This position will be assigned to the working location of the Central Office - Indianapolis, IN.This unique and fast-paced customer-facing role plays an integral part in strategic customer initiatives that have a significant impact on a rapidly growing organization. This position will be responsible for collecting and analyzing data from prospective customers and collaborating with Medxcel leadership in the development of program and pricing strategies to position the company to optimize profitability. This includes ensuring the requirements are interpreted correctly and identifying risks and opportunities in the data to help construct facilities management service program solutions. This position will communicate with customer financial leaders to obtain data; perform forensic analysis of the general ledger; and assess vendor service contracts, customer inventory, and labor to determine current expenses and develop pro-forma projections and other assumptions. Assist in winning new business by conducting market and customer analysis to understand the scope of the request and develop facilities management servicing program solutions that meet the needs of the customerPrepare, manipulate, and extract data and information from multiple internal and external sources and leverage to develop and execute sound pricing strategiesAssist in developing high quality projection models that incorporate complex financial and operational data to support pricing strategy and decision makingProduce in depth reporting and analysis for key business stakeholdersPreparation and analysis of financial models to quantify the projected revenue and profit on new business opportunitiesAnalyze facilities management servicing costs and conduct profitability analysis of possible pricing strategiesCustomer strategy development includes partnering with sales and collaborating with other functional areas to deliver an impressive presentationParticipate in client presentations and educate prospective customers on the breadth of services offeredEducation:Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or related fieldExperience:5 years relevant financial experiencePricing, corporate accounting, and/or financial analysis experience preferredKnowledge, Skills and Abilities:Ability to communicate and understand complex revenue streams and pricing structuresProven ability to extract insights from data and share findings in appropriate presentation formatsAbility to build, establish, and manage collaborative relationshipsAbility to be strategic and contribute to the development of creative solutions to problemsProject management skills with the ability to prioritize work and balance multiple projectsExcellent analytical and technical skills including proficiency in pro forma developmentStrong Microsoft Office suite skills; advanced Excel skills (i.e. pivot tables, macros, etc.) desirableProblem solving and critical thinking skillsStrong written and verbal communication skillsHigh energy and enthusiasm, with a strong commitment to exceeding customer expectationsFlexibility and openness to work in a variety of assignments, capacities, and rolesAbility to learn quickly, make an immediate impact, and provide value-add serviceStrong communication and interpersonal skills, displaying the ability to connect and build relationships with clients, firm leadership, and peersConfidence in professional aptitude and ability to effectively convey skills, knowledge, and qualifications to internal and external customersTeam player with a strong desire to be an active, long-term participant in the growth of the organizationEntrepreneurial spirit and belief in the opportunities that Medxcel offersInterest and passion to get involved with business and corporate developmentSome travel (up to 10%) may be required

Name: Data Warehousing Analyst
Description: This position is typically filled at a salary of $59,202Work for Indiana U.S News & World Reports #1 state government! With more than 50 executive branch agencies, the State of Indiana is a diverse workforce offering applicants stimulating and challenging projects across a broad scope of career opportunities. As a State of Indiana employee, you impact the well-being of Indianas communities every day. About Indiana Department of Transportation The Indiana Department of Transportation (INDOT) provides a dynamic workplace that serves Indiana citizens, improves our states quality of life, and enhances its economic opportunity. INDOT has a number of innovative programs and projects, including Public-Private Partnerships, Green Initiatives, and cutting-edge uses of materials and assets. As part of the State of Indiana, INDOT offers a competitive total compensation package, as well as outstanding work/life balance. Whether you are an established professional in the transportation field or just starting your career, INDOT has exciting and challenging opportunities for you. About the Job Employee works in the Data Management section of the Management Information Systems (MIS) Division in Indiana Department of Transportation (INDOT) at a senior level, and reports to the manager of the section. Employee utilizes data warehouse building/maintenance tools to collect data from various INDOT systems and external sources, loads it in the data warehouse and builds queries/reports on this data. A Day in the LifeDevelop, maintain, and support the enterprise data warehouse and corresponding data marts;Research source data, understand reporting needs and prepare the data warehouse to store data and deliver it to the queries/reports/dashboards in the most efficient manner.Build, run and maintain the Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) routines;Review data loaded into the data warehouse for accuracy;Build and maintain queries/reports/dashboards to display the data from the warehouse;Establish written procedures, guidelines and development standards for data warehouse operation;Confer with section management for planning, organizing and controlling the activities of assigned area;Provide input to MIS management on the status of ongoing projects and existing applications;Perform other duties as assigned.What Were Looking ForBachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field required.Advanced knowledge of data warehouse design and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) design tools, preferably Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) required.Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools such as Oracle SQL Developer and TOAD required;Advanced knowledge of enterprise database design, Structured Query Language (SQL) - data definition language (DDL) and data manipulation language (DML), and data dictionaries required;Advanced knowledge of query/report design tools such as Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE) and Oracle Data Visualization Desktop (ODVD) required;Advanced knowledge of computer hardware/software capabilities and configurations required;Advanced knowledge of data communication, systems connectivity and Windows operating system required;Ability to perform logic analysis required;Ability to read and understand complex technical manuals required;Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing requiredBenefits of Working for INDOT The Indiana Department of Transportation offers a comprehensive benefit package which includes: Four (4) medical plan options (including RX coverage) and vision/dental coveragesWellness program (offers eligibility into a discounted medical plan)Health savings account (includes bi-weekly state contribution)Deferred compensation account (similar to 401k plan) with employer matchTwo (2) fully-funded pension plan optionsGroup life insuranceEmployee assistance program that allows for covered behavioral health visitsPaid vacation, personal and sick time offCompetitive leave policies covering a variety of employee needs12 company paid holidays, 14 on election yearsQualified employer for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness ProgramNew Parent LeaveEqual Employment Opportunity: The State of Indiana is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Job Type: Full-time  Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required)

Name: Food & Beverage Business Unit - Customer Success Partner Manager
Description: Develops and manages the Oracle Support relationship with a designated large account or small number of medium accounts throughout engagement. Maximizes the customers use of Support Services, drives high degree of satisfaction and referenceability, and to protects and enhances Support revenue streams.  Main contact for Oracle customers. Manages the contract, or delivery engagement as defined by Oracle Service Support (OSS). Develops and maintains relationships with senior management across lines of business and third parties. Plans and deploys support activities to ensure effective delivery within agreed budgetary constraints. Advises the account on effective and efficient way to use Oracle support services and products, tools, systems, interfaces, and procedures. Assures and improves the quality of the service, and maintains accurate account information. Communicates opportunities for customers to engage with Oracle such as technical events and business seminars. Assists in the renewal of Support contracts, and contributes to pre-sales activities.  5-8 years of relevant experience. Specialist in account management practice. Fully proficient practitioner able to communicate at all levels within the account and create opportunities for the client to grow and improve their Oracle products and services. Proven ability to be customer focused, and developed acumen to cultivate and develop lasting customer relations. Job duties are varied and complex, needing independent judgment. May have project lead role.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.  Food & Beverage Global Business Unit  As a member of the Support organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle Partners, while serving as an advocate for those Partner needs and subsequent end user customer needs. The Customer Success Partner Manager is responsible for delivering a high degree of customer satisfaction by partnering with the internal Oracle teams to ensure the customers expectations are met. Through that partnership, you will be required to create and action improvement plans that cross customer and Oracle, to improve overall Customer Satisfaction.  In addition you will guide our Partners to provide outstanding customer experiences through the use of our platform and services. You will be the trusted advisor our Partners rely on to provide best practice and knowledge on the Oracle Cloud solutions. Work with multiple complex customers to develop long term partnershipsAct as primary point of contact for the customer throughout the entire Lifecycle of our partners customerAdvise Partners via introduction calls and welcome materials, including on boarding information and effective and efficient ways to use Oracle support services and products, tools, systems, interfaces, and proceduresActs as Oracle navigator to gain access to necessary Oracle Resources. Includes Cloud Operations Guidance and Technical SupportEducate Partners on the value of the overall solution and encourage optimal utilizationGather Partners product feedback to help product management define the product roadmap In this role, you will be considered the lead Partner liaison for strategic, top-revenue Partner accounts, and will attend one-on-one meetings with representatives of the strategic accounts. You will be responsible for managing internal projects, repeat incident management and problem management, creating initiatives, presenting across lines of businesses, identifying and driving productivity improvement opportunities, coordinating, preparing and qualifying Premier Analysts for Partner Visits and employee mentoring.  Job duties are varied and complex, needing independent judgment. Because of the nature of this position, a proven track record of demonstrated working skills including, but not limited to, excellent verbal and written communication skills, project management skills, ability to multitask and work under pressure, and (most importantly) an unabbreviated commitment to ensuring customer success. Bachelor*s Degree in either communications or information systems, previous account management and customer-focused experience, training experience in a software environment, prior working knowledge of or the desire to quickly learn about Oracle*s products, and six years related experience. *Job:** **Support**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *Food & Beverage Business Unit - Customer Success Partner Manager**Location:** *United States**Requisition ID:** *18001B0M*

Name: Metrics Exec Advisor (Business Intelligence Advisor)-Indianapolis onsite preferred-PS
Description: Your Talent. Our Vision. At Anthem, Inc., it’s a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we’re creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will drive the future of health care. This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.Metrics Exec Advisor (Business Intelligence Advisor) Indianapolis preferredThe Metrics Executive Advisor (Business Intelligence Advisor) will have a deep understanding of healthcare operations, operational data and systems. The Advisor will take a consultative role in supporting the Commercial Claims and G&A organizations along with departmental leadership, adding value by articulating the data needs of business units by analyzing data trends and outliers. They will develop and execute on the business intelligence strategy for the domains by providing insight to the business utilizing an array of reporting tools and analytics. The position functions as a resource for the Commercial Claims and G&A operational business units, including helping to drive connectivity with finance, actuarial and other operational domains. The position will provide disciplined, rigorous and sophisticated analyses aimed at transparency, identifying successes and opportunities for improvement. They will also consult with business partners to support decision making and driving intelligent action to support One Anthem transformation. The Advisor will work with departmental management and other Advisors to assimilate and analyze cross domain metrics.Primary duties may include, but are not limited to:• Lead the consolidated reporting and analysis efforts and executive reporting• Responsible for the execution of initiatives and programs with a primary focus on advanced analytics and capabilities (data, analytic platforms, and analytic applications & tools) that are used to drive growth and transformation for the identified operational units.• Responsible for working with departmental personnel to optimize reporting and analytic practices to realize efficiencies in the lights-on operations within the department.• Works closely with business partners to provide statistical analytical rigor in support of day-to-day and critical business decisions• Works with domain specific teams to source data and develop analyzes to gain business insights and support business objectives• Ensure the integrity and security of data is held to the highest standards by working with data management• Create proactive analytics to ensure optimal decision making by business partners and retrospective summaries to tell the operational story • Make process improvement recommendations based on analytics activities through data analysis as well as other sources of information such as work force management, claims analyst, internal leadership discussions etc. • Requires:BA/BS degree; MBA or BA/BS degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Finance, preferred• 7+ years of progressive large scale project management and/or strategic planning and execution; experience with analytics packages; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background• Strong business acumen within healthcare industry including but not limited to operations and finance• Ability to clearly articulate business requirements allowing for the data aggregation of multiple disparate data sources into a consumable data set• Strong understanding Microsoft SQL Business Intelligence suite of tools including SSDB, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, MDS, and all related components and tools such as SQL Management Studio, SQL Data Tools in Visual Studio (with BIDS Helper), SQL Server Report Builder and PowerBI Desktop.• Ability to generate clear, concise and comprehensive analyses that tell the story behind the data and drives intelligent action• Proficiency in data visualization / dashboard best practices preferred.• Excellent relationship management and oral and written communication skills, including the ability to communicate sophisticated statistical models and other complex quantitative information at levels suitable for a broader business audienceAnthem, Inc. is ranked as one of America’s Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine and is a 2015 DiversityInc magazine Top 50 Company for Diversity. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at antheminc.com/careers. EOE. M/F/Disability/Veteran.

identifying trends and recommending actionsWork with business units and cross-functional organizations to accomplish task by leading and coordinating information requirementsSupport in preparing high quality, professional, and accurate presentations and memorandums for management and board of directors in a timely basisDevelop detailed financial models for potential transactions, including but not limited to M&A, capital expenditures, and plant expansionsQualifications/ Requirements:One to three years of relevant experience in financial planning and analysis or corporate developmentA bachelor's degree in finance or accounting, or equivalent practical experienceTop 20 business school preferredExceptional proficiency in Excel and Access: discounted cash flow modeling, scenario analysis, and statistical analysisDemonstrated work experience: financial statement analysis, modeling, and reporting; critical thinking, and executive presentationsStrong interpersonal skills with proven ability to collaborate effectively using broad range of influence styles to drive desired resultsImpeccable written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey various forms of information to broad audienceHigh degree of self-confidence, poise, maturity, discretion, and diplomacySelf-motivated and passionate with a drive for success enthusiastic about delivering high-quality work and making a difference in your function, our company, and our industryAbility to work with and act in utmost confidentiality with sensitive company informationHave a strong ownership mentality and drive for resultsSound problem solver who can quickly process complex information and present it clearly and simplyStrong knowledge of MS Office applications including Word, Excel, SharePoint, Access, and PowerPointAbout us: Asphalt Materials, Inc., formed in 1956, has been continually focused on the asphalt business. The Heritage Group (THG) is a family-owned company that has been in operation for over 80 years. THG turns big challenges into even bigger opportunities. THG is a family of relationship-builders, problem-solvers and opportunity seekers that aim to make a difference in the world. This vast experience combined with a team management style allows for the diversity of a large conglomerate and the personal service of a smaller, customer-focused organization. THG is a growth-oriented company with operations in North America, Europe, and Asia and a customer network that spans the globe. As a family-owned business, a long-term financial approach and conservative investment philosophy have placed the Company on a solid foundation to pursue growth opportunities as they appear. Name: Analyst- Financial Covenants

Assist with small projects and begin to identify and assist with process improvement initiativesUse effective listening skills and professional verbal and written communication to liaise with internal Cortland teams and external partiesContinue developing knowledge of terms, concepts, systems and procedures. Desired Experience, Education & Qualifications:Associate or Bachelor’s degree in business preferred; relevant work experience is a plusHighly organized and motivated with exceptional attention to detailAbility to quickly learn new concepts and adapt to/excel in a fast-paced, dynamic team environment Highly Interested in or knowledge of reviewing loan/legal documentation and financial reporting documentation, preferably in a financial services environment a plusProficiency and accuracy in data entry and experience with Microsoft Excel and Outlook a plusCortland values intellectually curious professionals who are interested in aggressively learning and sharing new concepts and skills collegially and independently. Salary is based on experience, skill level and education for the target position. Name: Security DevOps Sr Analyst - Location Negotiable
Description: Job descriptionApplication Security professionals assess, define, implement and/or support world-class security, for Accenture or our clients, spanning simple IT projects to large-scale, enterprise-level transformation programs.The DevSecOps Sr Analyst assesses, defines, implements and/or supports DevSecOps programs for Accenture or our clients. either military or civilian + Basic qualificationsBasic Qualifications:Minimum 1 year of Application security experience including proficiency in AppSec concepts such as those in OWASP top 10, etc.Minimum of 1 of the following: 1 year of experience in one or more security testing tools, including Static Analysis and/or Dynamic Analysis1 year of experience working in Agile methodologies and transformations, as well as E2E understanding of the SDLC1 year of experience in at least one configuration & continuous integration tool such as Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Jenkins, Hudson, Maven, Ant, Git, SonarBonus – Exposure to one or more of the following: Container technology such as Docker, OpenShiftCloud deployments and securityVulnerability and threat assessment/remediationGovernance, reporting and escalation best practicesMinimum Bachelor degree, preferred Bachelor of Science in a technical concentration (Engineering, Computer Science, MIS) Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status). Name: SAP General Accounting FICO Functional Analyst
Description: SAP General Accounting FICO Functional Analyst30-Nov-201829-Jan-2019ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities: Lilly is a global healthcare leader that unites caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We were founded more than a century ago by a man committed to creating high-quality medicines that meet real needs, and today we remain true to that mission in all our work. Across the globe, Lilly employees work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to communities through philanthropy and volunteerism.The SAP FI-CO Functional Analyst will work within the GA team, which is part of the wider Global Services IT organization. Global Services IT (GSIT) is responsible for providing solutions for SAP and SAP-integrated systems, enabling supply chain management, human resources, and financial business processes. A key role within the GA team is the SAP FI-CO Functional Analyst. The primary focus will be collaborating with our business partners, and influencing the processes, tools and operating models within the General Accounting (GA) area. GA includes functional support for treasury, tax, product costing and other financial platforms. The role will involve both determining the nature of the business need (“Define and Design”) by partnering with Functional Architects and enabling solution delivery (“Build, Test, and Deploy”) orchestrating/coordinating resources including External Service Providers (ESPs). The SAP FI-CO Functional Analyst role includes understanding the SAP global template and the impact of making changes whether through the change/enhancement or project delivery methodology, ensuring that these services are provided on time, on budget, and in a quality and compliant manner in order to meet required business outcomes. Key Objectives/Deliverables:Partner and collaborate with global, regional and local Business Partners as appropriate in order to better understand the business and its priorities, and represent their requirements within the SAP landscape.Lead, manage and participate in day to day operations, enhancements and projects. This includes understanding business impact, quantifying resources, and evaluating/recommending technical options.Partner with the business in assessing and defining requirements and lead/execute the development of business cases and system solutions.Influence partner organizations to manage and prioritize incidents, system changes and projects.Promote process improvements and innovation to drive business process optimization.Partner with third party providers to accomplish delivery of day to day operations, enhancements and projects. This includes: service level management, resource evaluations, escalations of system issues and oversight of the change management processes.Be forward thinking with respect to using various SAP technologies which will help improve the user experience.Be an advocate for SAP at global, regional and local level to communicate standards and expectations.Opportunity to become an expert in the SAP technologies that run the Lilly financial business processes, as well as the opportunity to understand the business processes that drive the business. Identify and ensure delivery of training needs between IT and the business.Where appropriate, work with colleagues on the GA team in SAP areas of treasury, tax, product costing, legal compliance, and SAP bolt-on systems.Leverage, and further develop, SAP FI technical skills in areas of FI, CO, Banking, Profitability, Tax, Assets and Product Costing to power the Lilly business to better serve patients and stakeholders around the world.Req ID43187BRAdditional Skills/PreferencesExperience working in a regulated industry (i.e. GMP) and delivering within that environment.Desire and ability to operate at multiple levels (detail and strategic).Excellent communication skills, using a variety of methods in diverse forums.Desire and ability to work independently with minimal direction.Additional InformationFull time day shift position.Occasional off hours and weekend work is expected as this position serves a global organization.Some regional and international travel will be required to meet with business partners and develop key working relationships as part of a global function.Lilly is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.TitleSAP General Accounting FICO Functional AnalystJob CategoryInformation TechnologyBasic QualificationsBachelors Degree2 years implementing and maintaining SAP, demonstrating relevant understanding of Finance functionality.2 years development, configuration, or support experience in SAP finance modules and functionalities.2 years experience working on global projects delivering to multiple business/sites.Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the United States. Name: Elanco Information Security Analyst FTE
Description: Job Category: Other Type of Employment: Full-Time Employment - FTE Responsibilities: The Information Security mission is to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information and assets, such that Elanco is able to deliver on the brand promise to our stakeholders and customers. We will follow a risk-based approach, aligned with business objectives, to address risks that may impact Elanco?s ability to operate in a secure manner. The Information Security Analyst is tasked with supporting Elanco Information Security initiatives.  The Information Security Project Analyst is responsible to ensure the rollout/ adoption of an enterprise-wide risk-based information security program. The role will involve coordination with Elanco Business, Information Technology and other Information Security teams to provide support for the overall IS Program in Elanco. This role will report into the Elanco Information Security Organization.  Primary Responsibilities  + Support the Elanco IS program with key deliverables for the IS team, IT team, and the broader Elanco workforce  + Provide consultative security guidance to a broad range of business and technical stakeholders and partners  + Partner with others in the deployment of security technologies/initiatives  + Maintain awareness of industry trends in IS  + Assist in the rollout of the IS organization in the new Elanco Basic Qualificiations: + Bachelor?s Degree  + Recent Information Security work experience  + Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the United States. Lilly/Elanco does not anticipate providing sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B or TN status) for this employment position. Additional Skills/Preferences: + Previous work designing or deploying information security solutions/programs  + Demonstrated ability to effectively share knowledge  + Strong communication, writing and presentation skills  + Demonstrated excellent strategic thinking and learning agility  + History of information security, information technology architecture knowledge and experiences  + Demonstrated ability to establish cross-functional relationships to drive innovation and productivity  + Business Acumen: proven ability to probe further to understand and solve issues that may not be obvious  + Experience in working in Elanco or other similar settings Additional Information: Elanco is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status Company Overview: Elanco is a global research-based company that develops and delivers products and services to enhance animal health and production. We value innovation, both in scientific research and daily operations, and strive to cultivate a collaborative work environment for more than 6,000 employees in more than 70 countries. Our worldwide headquarters and research facilities are located in Greenfield, Indiana. Posted Date:Keyword:Region: City: Greenfield  State: Indiana Country:Location Details: Req Id: 45092BR

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThis position can only be filled with a retired management employee or a Former with a positive rehire status referred by the Hiring Manager. The Feeder Dispatch Lead will be responsible for overseeing the Dispatch activity to ensure timely and proficient service. He/She will monitor dispatch schedules to ensure adequate staffing for transportation needs, will track dispatch modifications, will review reports and analyze data to create plans to maximize dispatch results, will monitor load movement to identify cost reductions, will review drivers hours of service, will oversee yard operations; staffing, shifter performance, verifies trailers are loaded and empty and confirms trailer inventory. Lead Dispatchers will not be required to travel between buildings but will be domiciled out of a Feeder office. Knowledgeable in Trailer Forecasting Control System (TFCS)- Able to track trailer movements for bypass and destined work. Is able to account for trailers on forecast. Has understanding of D.O.T. hours of service and can account for drivers who are assigned to him/her. The Feeder drivers will continue to report to and be managed by a management person. Can use ?Hub and Feeder Control System (HFCS)? and ?Schedule and Dispatch Editing (SADE)? programs. Must be able to add/edit a driver?s schedule. Has previous knowledge of HFCS and its functionality. Demonstrates a detailed understanding of processes, procedures, and methods; demonstrates a broad knowledge of tools, equipment, and technology; describes and understands the general structure of the operation. Approximately 40 hours per week (able to work overtime as needed); occasional weekends as needed. This Feeder Dispatch Lead position does not have the authority to make any pre-employment or employment decisions or sign regulatory documents. These roles/responsibilities would fall to the management person that this Lead reports to. This person will be responsible for providing input to the management on Feeder Driver Performance. Hours: 8:00am to 5:00pm Work Week: 1 - Monday, 2 - Tuesday, 3 - Wednesday, 4 - Thursday, 5 - Friday, 6 - Saturday

Name: Supply Chain Analyst
Description: The Supply Chain Analyst will play an integral role in coordinating, and optimizing day to day operations of our distribution fulfillment center in Plainfield, IN. You will work directly with Coldwater Creek (Coldwater) Inventory Planning, Sourcing, and Customer Service teams to ensure smooth operation of inbound product receipts, outbound processes, and overall service levels at the distribution center. Name: Technical Consultant

Name: P2P Business Consultant
Description: Determine develops innovative software that the worlds most successful companies rely on to improve the effectiveness of their sales and contracting processes. Our guided selling, sales configuration, and contract lifecycle management solutions support the Global 2000 and growing mid-size firms in closing billions of dollars worth of business each year.  The Business Consultant acts as an interface between our clients business teams and our product teams. The consultant implements software solutions by adapting to the clients needs and adjusting capabilities of the software. This includes configuring the tool based on functional specifications, training users, and providing advice to clients on best practice processes and areas for improvement.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Partner with clients to design, develop/configure, and build solutions to help them reimagine and reshape their source-to-pay process (S2P).Conduct thorough business process analysis and provide guidance.Work as part of the implementation team.Provide client configuration training regarding Determines implementation methodology.Collaborate with internal and external team(s) through problem definition, issue identification and work plan development.Support change management activities to prepare the client for deployment and adoption. REQUIREMENTS Bachelors Degree in Business Administration, Contract Law, Supply Chain, Accounting, Finance, related field or applicable work experienceMinimum 3 years of relevant work experienceExperience with process design, demonstration of thought leadership and implementation of process improvementHigh degree of integrityStrong familiarity with project management processes and methodologyAnalytical thinking and problem solving, ability to effectively identify business issues and opportunities, assess proposed solutions and meet stakeholder needs.Ability to present ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language.Excellent written, oral, interpersonal, and presentation skills.S2P software/ERP system knowledge a plusUnderstanding of procurement, strategic sourcing, and contract management business processes a plusPer Determine policy, all third parties desiring to assist or assisting Determine with recruiting and/or related processes must work strictly through the Director of Global Human Resources at hr@determine.com. The Determine Director of Global Human Resources is the only employee with any authority to direct, or receive information from, such third parties and no other Determine employee or related party has the authority or agency to direct any such actions or receive any such information.

Name: REPO Plus Financial Analyst
Description: Position Summary: This position will be responsible for the development, monitoring, trending, collection and analysis of all aspects of operational and account performance data and analytics within the REPO Plus department., This position will provide weekly, monthly, quarterly and yearly operational performance analysis and trending and dissemination of this information will allow for operational practice improvements, account communication and investigation, case and pricing alterations and other critical product changes. The Financial Analyst role will work closely within the REPO Plus leadership team, the client and field support and sales teams, loan tracking division, accounting and underwriting to ensure product and department margins and financial targets are met or exceeded. This position will be responsible for providing operational reports and financial analysis on a schedules and ad hoc basis. The reporting and project team within REPO Plus will also be supporting this position. This individual will serve as the Subject Matter Expert and central resource within the department for all analysis and reporting needs. The REPO Plus Financial Analyst will possess mastery level mathematical, statistical and analytical abilities and be able to do all levels of analytic analysis and statistical modeling to identify in a proactive manner performance forecasts and identify trends and opportunities for improvement with the end goal being optimization of recovery for the REPO Plus client, department and division. Job Duties:40% The REPO Plus Financial Analyst is responsible for the development, monitoring, analyzation, and production of performance data that drives improved operational and department performance. Continued monitoring of said data and operational impact to ensure improvements made are hitting projected targets as outlined and delivered.30% Manage and deliver all account and client analysis contained within quarterly, semi- annual and annual business reviews and provide insight, analysis, statistical monitoring and the projections of future performance and the return on investment per client tied to the REPO Plus Product line.20% Work closely with loan tracking, client risk and financial management, accounting and other operational areas within the company to deliver improvements to the product line.10% Perform other duties up to and including but not limited to publishing reports, dashboard monitoring and scorecard production as assigned. Solicit reporting requirements using interviews, document analysis, business process descriptions, use case diagrams, written scenarios, business process analysis;Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver information as required;Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of the REPO Plus product and workflows for each individual client;Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, clients, and subject matter experts;Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs;Act as the liaison between the business units, technology teams, and support teams.Qualification:Bachelor’s degree; Masters degree preferred not requiredIn exchange for Masters Degree, proven job experience in financial analyst role preferably tied to a distinct business or Product Line2 - 5 years of related experience in financial and/or operational statistical modeling and forecasting, data analysis, forecasting and operational projections and performance including pricing, profit and margin activitiesExceptional analytical abilities, mastery in statistics, data analysis and compilation skills.Strong attention to detail; ability to multi task and deliver professional data in succinct business oriented reporting with data driven recommendationsStrong organizational and time management skills; ability to communicate to both internal and external clients at executive levelsProficiency in Microsoft Office Products, particularly Excel and strong skills to produce and automate reports through officeExperience in financial services related field is preferred but not required

Name: Land Financial Analyst
Description: We know that BUILDING HOMES & COMMUNITIES BEGINS WITH BUILDING THE BEST TEAM!How would you like to be part of a team that has been providing the American Dream of homeownership to families for more than 60 years? PulteGroup is a FORTUNE 500 company and one of America’s top residential builders. We put the consumer at the center of everything we do and we stand above the competition in our commitment to quality.Our Vision is to Build Consumer Inspired Homes & Communities to Make Lives Better and we believe that success starts with having the right people. At PulteGroup, we are committed to diversity and inclusion. We value the differences of each employee and understand that being consumer inspired means that we reflect the diversity of the consumers we serve.A position with PulteGroup offers a rich, fulfilling and rewarding career across multiple geographies and brands. If you are interested in being a part of our team, let’s talk about your career with PulteGroup!PulteGroup is seeking a Land Financial Analyst in Indianapolis!JOB SUMMARY: Primary responsibility for managing financial accounting for the Division’s land assets and/or performing financial analysis of land acquisition, entitlement or development activities. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:Assists Land and Finance teams to ensure appropriate documentation of all land entitlement and development expenditures and budgetsAssists in the feasibility process by preparing models to support the Land and Finance teamsLeads monthly reviews with Land and Finance teams to reconcile all land balances and development budgets. Ensures all lot cost assumptions are appropriate and documented.Prepares monthly and quarterly financial reports for submission to Home OfficePrepares soft cost budget analysis (property taxes, HOA funding, and land overhead absorption) and lot cost calculationsAssists in forecasting cash flows relative to land purchase and development expendituresMANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIES LEVEL:MENTOR / COACH / FEEDBACKWithout Direct ReportsDeveloping a financial mindset amongst the land development managers to create accounting/financial/budget acumenSCOPE:Decision Impact: DivisionDepartment Responsibility: Multiple (Land/Finance)Budgetary Responsibility: YesDirect Reports: NoIndirect Reports: NoPhysical Requirements: If applicableREQUIRED EDUCATION:(degree, licenses, certifications, etc.)Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or Accounting (or equivalent in related field)Certified Public Accounting license (active or inactive) preferredREQUIRED EXPERIENCE:(work related, tools/equipment, software, etc.)Related Functional Experience: Minimum 3 years public and/or corporate accounting experienceStrong analytical skillsGood knowledge of GAAP and financial reportsVerbal and written communication skills Apply

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Senior Financial Analyst Your tasks Your tasksDB Schenker is the world's leading global logistics provider - we support industry and trade in the global exchange of goods through land transport, worldwide air and ocean freight, contract logistics and supply chain management. Integrated logistics resides at the world's most important intersections, where the flow of goods creates an effective link between carriers. Our value-added services ensure the flow of goods continues seamlessly and supply chains stay lean and optimized for success. Our business holds top positions in automotive, technology, consumer goods, trade fair logistics, special transports, and special events logistics.Position Description Summary:  Accumulate, analyze, forecast and report a variety of financial data used in the decision-making process of the business. Responsible for developing, interpreting, and implementing financial concepts for financial planning and control. Perform technical analysis to determine present and future financial performance. Gather, analyze, prepare, and summarize recommendations for financial plans, acquisition activity, trended future requirements, operating forecasts, and others. Provide economic research and studies in the areas of rates of return, NPV and EVA. Provide a variety of financial data used in the decision-making process of the organization. Analyze and project all aspects of company financial performance to provide managerial visibility.  Principal Accountabilities (The following is intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. It is not an exhaustive list of all expectations.): Assist in the coordination of the Forecast, Annual Operating and Strategic planning processesMonitor and analyze monthly financial performance, provide variance explanations and advise line management of deviations and recommend actions to ensure business goals are metReview all systems, structures and processes to identify where improvements can be made to enhance overall operating and financial performanceGather business intelligence to support assumptions used to derive forecast and Plan resultsPrepare financial analysis to focus management's attention on potential pitfalls and added-value activitiesParticipate in projects and support operating profit improvement and growth initiatives The individual in this position must be capable of performing all of the essential functions with or without a reasonable accommodation.Knowledge and Skills (The following minimum requirements are normal guidelines and should not constrain the advancement of otherwise qualified personnel):  This is a senior level position. Exceptional interpersonal and analytical skills required. Bachelor's degree or equivalent required. Generally prefer 3-6 years of related experience. Strong understanding of activity based costing is critical.Requirements Requirements Our offer Our offer Contact Contact Job Details Job Details PositionSenior Financial AnalystID201803130033CompanySchenker, Inc.CityPlainfield, IndianaCreatedMar 12, 2018

Name: Senior Consultant
Description: Senior Consultant - Securities Division General Duties: You are responsible for the facilitation of sales by appointed producers through MarketShare Financial by supporting and training producer groups to better meet their clients’ needs. This is accomplished through the maximization of their practices and augmentation of their capabilities. Conduct and support recruitment and development of new producers and agencies. Develop and maintain a technical base of knowledge within your area of expertise. Cultivate and maintain close relationships with producers and position MarketShare Financial as a sustaining resource to the producer field force. Primary Responsibilities:Provide Expertise. Develop a complete understanding of all securities division programs including Envestnet ENV2, Pershing NetX360/Advisor, NFS Streetscape and educate our producers on all systems. Create example portfolios, analyze strategists and recommend portfolios available on B/D platform. Track the performance of stock market and help interpret for producers. Research and track the financial position of a specific companies or industries using resources such as Morningstar, Bloomberg, etc. Evaluate current and historical data that helps in decision making for our producers. Recommend individual investments options and collective investment options. Study economic and business trends and communicate them to our producers.Develop a Plan. Understand your market, profitability and resources to create a plan to meet company strategic objectives. Manage the plan to maximize company objectives. Communicate with company leadership, partners, peers and other personnel to explore new ideas and input that might help in strengthening the business unit and company. Exercise discipline in the execution of the plan.Build Strong, Positive and Lasting Relationships. We are privileged to work with some of the best producers in the industry. We need to create an environment that enables producers to conduct business with MarketShare Financial in an efficient, effective and positive manner. Our producers should look forward to communicating with us as business partners and friends. These same standards and goals should extend to our partners, suppliers and peers.Maximize Producer Production. Enable appointed producers to realize their full production potential. Includes the ability to communicate advanced concepts, effective product recommendations, creative portfolio design, problem solving, book optimization, fee-based transition techniques, technical, sales and marketing support. Identify new and existing opportunities to help clients and motivate the producer to action.Prospecting and Recruiting. Identify and pursue quality agents and agencies on a continuous, on-going basis with the objective to recruit them to MarketShare Financial.Technical and Product Knowledge. Maintain a thorough knowledge of market and fee based expertise. Assemble and maintain comprehensive industry materials and knowledge, current market trends, state approvals, required forms, etc. Connect producers to subject matter experts when appropriate. Concentrate additional study on stock market analysis, advanced investment concepts, modeling and third party strategies. The objective is to position MarketShare Financial as a highly credible source for field climate, trends, and other important strategic information. Contribute individual talents and knowledge to improve the overall MarketShare team.Public Presentation and Communication. Ability to communicate effectively and with confidence in public and business forums. Poised, professional demeanor in all situations, including telephone, teleconferencing, webinars, seminars and social functions.Self-Directive Management/Efficient Use of Time. Ability to maximize time and resources in order to accomplish objectives. Does not require constant management or supervision in the setting and attainment of goals. Ability to maintain and balance multiple high-level tasks and responsibilities for extended periods of time. Special focus on a sense of urgency and an ability to prioritize important objectives.Secondary Responsibilities:Act as liaison between the home office and the field to ensure that quality control objectives are met and smooth workflow exists.Promote and coordinate cross-marketing opportunities.Timely and accurate completion of projects.Contributions to MarketShare Financial Marketing Plan on a timely basis.Responsible use of MarketShare Financial expenses to meet company profitability objectives.Identification and pursuit of opportunities for professional development.Suggesting ideas and improvements to existing MarketShare Financial systems and procedures.On-going evaluation of existing product portfolio and due diligence on prospective additions or deletions.Maintain open communications with all internal associates and departments.Host or assist with meetings and events when needed.Assist with any special marketing projects as needed.Requirements: College graduate. Experience in Securities Industry required. Candidate must possess current Series 7 and Series 66 Licensing. CFA designation is preferred. Individual must possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and the desire to educate. Very strong personal organization and follow-up, as well as the ability to handle multiple tasks and projects are a must. Other characteristics include enthusiastic, self-directed, goal-oriented, ethical and flexible. Strong problem solving skills and team-oriented attitude are vital.

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst
Description: OverviewSupport strategic decision making and planning through analysis and enhancement of financial ratio, analytics and metrics of the organization. Responsibilities include cost accounting for commercial/service business, variance analysis, variable sales expense analysis, shipping profitability analysis and pricing management. Also includes warranty spend evaluation and service event data, service business budget analysis and cash to accrual journal entries from aforementioned analysis. Reporting of commercial KPI’s, balance sheet management for service business and billing, collection and reconciliation of service business receivables.Responsibilities Promotes Helmer values as demonstrated in personal productivity and quality of work, management of internal/external relationships, actively seeking out and participating in Continuous Improvement practices, and willingness to engage and support team initiatives.Comply with workplace safety procedures.Use financial ratios, analytics and metrics to analyze and look for opportunities to enhance organizational performance, drive continuous improvement and drive post sale service business opportunities.Support commercial teams with accounting support for partner commission calculations; administrative fee calculations, reporting and payment processing; contract price management; cash to accrual journal entries; freight and BVA analysis, .Service Business Cost Accounting – standard cost maintenance through analysis of, labor and overhead absorption for various service offerings.Analysis of Service Event Data for evaluation of customer experienceBalance Sheet analysis and for service business including inventory (virtual warehouses and field stock), receivables reconciliation and collectionsPost-Sale analysis including warranty spend evaluation and reporting and analysis of customer install baseReview and report KPI’s for TSR, CSR. QualificationsRelative Work Experience: 7+ years in analytical role required. Experience in service environment preferred. Education: BS degree in Accounting required. MBA preferred. Solid understanding of the budget and forecast; full understanding of financial ratios and analysis. Certifications / Licenses:  Computer Systems / Software: Advanced Excel skills (pivot tables, if/then statements, nested functions, formulas) Specialized Training:  Key Competencies: Complex analytical abilitiesStrong communicating and partnering skillsExperience working with large data setsUnderstanding of accounting principles and reportingCompetency of complex financial conceptsAbility to understand intricate financial business problems and help determine appropriate solutions

Name: Store Support Analyst
Description: The Cellular Connection (TCC) is the largest Verizon Premium Wireless Retailer in the country. Our extensive knowledge of the wireless industry and the relationship that we have established with Verizon allows us to provide our customers with a unique and personal sales experience. At The Cellular Connection we are looking for individuals that share our passion for providing this exceptional sales experience. Why work for The Cellular Connection? https://youtu.be/47p2aXxuAZA The Cellular Connection (TCC) is dedicated to its employees to provide an extremely unique culture that allows our employees to love where they work. We also work to ensure that our employees have the opportunity to continue their personal/professional development. The Cellular Connection (TCC) is committed to not only providing our customers/employees with a great experience but also committed to giving back to our communities.Primary Purpose: Reports to the Director of Store Support providing assistance and support to store personnel for Level 1 Services with the primary goal of enabling retail sales. Provides enhanced troubleshooting and resolution of incidents. The Store Support Analyst will be proficient in addressing all Core Level 1 Services. Responds to all requests in a prompt and timely manner.Key activities for this role include: Proficient in solving Core Level 1 Services.Able to work with minimal manager direction.Recognizes and escalates when a Problem is identified.Manages incidents via telephone, in person, email, chat and through self- service portal/App.Recommends process improvements to the support model.Provides first line support by troubleshooting incidents related to Level 1 Services. Effectively documents troubleshooting steps to provide escalation teams enough information to resolve issues escalated to Level 2 Support.Takes ownership of end user issues; provides status updates on behalf of the user and communicates progress in a timely manner.Maintains a high degree of customer service for all support queries and adheres to all Service Management principlesDevelops support documentation in collaboration with other Store Support teams and utilizes the documentation to assist in troubleshootingWorks with external partners (vendors) for support where issues cannot be resolved internally.Responds to complex “How To” questions of Business Operational processes, external applications, internal applications, and other Level 1 Services.Effectively uses ServiceNow for managing incident work. May use other tools such as knowledge bases, mobile device management tools and asset tracking as needed.Has a fundamental understanding of ITIL and ITSM.Will maintain a 90> plus customer satisfaction rating of “Completely Satisfied”.Additional Dimensions:Excellent time management, organizational, personnel, and problem solving skills.Ability to work and communicate with all levels of the organization.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Highly dependable with a “Can Do” attitude.Must be able to work weekends/evenings as needed.Ability to function effectively within a team and as an individual contributor.The accomplished individual will possess the following:High school diploma, general education degree (GED) or related support experience in an area such as IT, Operations or Retail. An Associate degree in IT or Business with 2 years of support experience is preferred.Proficient in the use of Microsoft Windows and Office products.Basic Knowledge of networking fundamentals and Mobile Devices.Solid understanding of general business operations.Excellent inter-personal skills.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Problem solving and analytical capabilities.Ability to execute assigned tasks swiftly, efficiently, and qualitatively.Ability to move and handle computer equipment generally weighing 0-50 pounds. Position involves spending long hours sitting using computers, which requires attention to detail and high levels of accuracy.The ability to read and understand technical and operational documentation. documents provided by other teams for support.Experience in a TCC store setting is desired.
