Name: Territory Business Manager, Diabetes
Description: Lexicon Pharmaceuticals is currently searching for an entrepreneurial, highly motivated, results focused Territory Business Manager, Diabetes - Indianapolis, IN. In this role, you will deliver sales results to support our key Diabetes Product launch. This position will live in the assigned territory and report to our Regional Business Leader, Diabetes. The successful incumbent will have a direct impact on the execution of our brand strategy and demonstrating our commercial values of keeping the patient at center, collaboration, relentless pursuit of excellence and trust in all we do. Job Summary: The Territory Business Manager will act as an integral member of our Commercial Sales team by delivering sales results for our key Type 1 Diabetes product launch. This direct customer facing role will be responsible for executing our brand and sales strategy to effectively demonstrate our product value to key customers Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:Applying knowledge and expertise of local market trends, institutions, and key customers to optimize our national strategy to drive business results at the territory level.Utilizing internal resources, such as market data and analysis to shape territory business plans to drive business results and impact patients.Using our internal systems to work through call planning and record call activity.Identifying and seizing opportunities to build organizational efficiency and process improvements to positively impact business resultsRequired Skills Required ExperienceQualifications:Bachelor’s degree is required.Minimum of 5 (five) years of experience in the pharmaceutical industryMinimum of 3 (three) years of sales experience, preferably in DiabetesProven track record of sales results, commitment to performance excellenceAbility to develop strategic long-term relationships with customers aimed at helping patients and achieving business resultsStrong alignment to our corporate values of patient at center, collaboration, relentless pursuit of excellence and trust in all we do To apply, please visit the careers section of our website: https://lexpharmacareers.silkroad.com/.  An Equal Opportunity Employer - Females, Minorities, Veterans, and Disabled  Lexicon Pharmaceuticals, Inc. is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test, background check and verification of credentials before beginning employment.Job Location  Indianapolis, US-IN

Name: Area Business Manager - Oil & Gas (6-10 yrs) UP/Aligarh/Gonda (Sales Management)
Description: Role Description- To support ABM to assess suitability of village/ village cluster for initiating business; - Develop a sales plan for the area for a 18 month horizon- Recruit and manage a team of RSA in the allocated territories- Train RSAs on sales process to ensure they are effectively performing on the field- Start business in an area- Recruit UM and make him productive- Manage UM on an ongoing basis to keep him productive- Understand and track key sales (e.g. leads, FR) and business (e.g. DBS) metrics - Support RSAs on the field in above activities to make them effective- Monitor day-to-day field movement of RSAs to ensure optimal coverage of territory- Develop and execute a monthly sales plan- To act as first level of quality check for all the customer applications hitting area office from his designated territory- Support other employees of the company to resolve customer problems in the local area like Payment Collection, generating payment points/recharge agents etc. - Report progress to reporting manager at prescribed intervals Process adherence and compliance- Learn company processes and attend trainings - To ensure adherence of RSAs and UMs with the business processes - To ensure conduct of business in ethical and transparent manner - To implement internal control measures with respect to business process, customer selection and customer communication. - To scan market constantly to seek alert and identify clues about any malpractices capable of affecting adversely - To safeguard interest in the designated territory Role Requirements- Age 30-40 years - Graduate mandatory, MBAs or any related professional degree preferable - Sales or service experience of at least 3 years- Team leadership experience of at least one year- Prior experience of doing business in rural India- Proficient in computer- Microsoft office - Willing to be based at Area Office locations- Willing to travel extensively in designated territory - Has his own bike or scooter;- Has (or is willing to buy) a smartphone compatible with the company systemCompensation Structure- Based on experience and expertise; - Variable: 50% of base comprising incentives linked with sales and portfolio (DBS45%)- Travel and mobile reimbursements- As per company policy - Other benefits- As per company policy If interested please apply with your updated resume or call at 9810143202 (ref:updazz.com)

Name: Credit Analyst
Description: Looking to join one of Best Places to Work in Indiana? Future advancement opportunities with a highly successful and growing bank. Community First Bank of Indiana is an established central Indiana Community Bank seeking an experienced Credit Officer with excellent verbal and written communication skills to join our team of professionals.  This individual will be a self-starter, who works independently to prepare concise, yet quality and comprehensive credit analysis summaries on existing and prospective small business, agricultural, commercial, and industrial and investment real estate customers. Essential DutiesDetermines credit worthiness of applicants, also makes recommendations to Credit Manager.Conducts written reports after evaluating key decision factors for credit decisions.Work closely with Loan officers and Loan committees in developing optimum loan structure and risk mitigation by suggesting appropriate covenants and conditions.Communicate with lenders after developing questions and assessing the initial information provided by the borrower.Partner with Loan officers on conference calls and occasionally make site visits.Ability to use financial software to perform analysis of existing loan portfolios.Conduct monthly reports to present to the Board of DirectorsAssist with bank and client auditsEducation/QualificationsBachelors degree in Business or related field preferred.Minimum of seven years experience in commercial credit or related field.Strong mathematical and analytical skillsStrong verbal and written communication skills.Thorough accounting knowledge with financial statements and tax returns.BenefitsHealth, Dental, Vision, 401KPTO (after 30 days)Wellness ProgramCompetitive SalaryAnnual bonus eligibilityHoliday Parties Job Type: Full-time  Experience: Credit Analysis: 7 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required)
